story:
Short Summary

For those that know me and those that don't, I'm a marathon freak.  PROUD marathon freak.  Before, I would run for the joy and passion of the sport.  While that part hasn't changed, what has is my focus and determination to make this more than just a fun hobby.  This ties with Olympic dreams.

I'm a NYC Marathon qualifier, and I'm using this race to get as close to a sub-3 hour marathon as I can.  I'm entered into the race, but life hits you at the worst times.  I have no way of getting to New York because uncontrolable circumstances leave me surviving paycheck to paycheck.  I know this is the first step towards my goal of qualifiying for the Olympic trials.

What We Need & What You Get

Let's start with YOU.  Read the right panel to check out what I'll be giving you as thank-you gifts!

I listed a goal of $2,000.  This is estimated for:

  • Airfare
  • Hotel
  • Food
  • Ground transportation

Anything raise over that is going straight into the Hall Steps Foundation, a foundation founded by Olympic marathoner (and American Full-marathon/Half-marathon record holder) Ryan Hall.  Originally I was part of his team for the NYC Marathon, trying to raise $1,000 for the foundation.  First I need to get there!

If I am unable to go to New York, the amount raised will still go towards the Hall Steps Foundation.

The Impact

My goal has always been to make it to the Olympic trials.  This race is the first step towards fighting for this goal.  I know I can complete a marathon, I've done 5!   But one thing is to complete and get a good time.  It's entirely different when you have those 5 Olympic rings dancing in your mind the entire race.  New York has given me the fastest time, and I'm positive I can go back and go even faster.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Send my video to friends and family
  • If you know of anybody/companies that would be interested in sponsoring me, please pass the word

story:
The Maze is horror/thriller survival game that includes scary environment, intense gameplay, deadly traps, terrifying entities and carefully engineered sound environment for best experience. Play singleplayer or switch to multiplayer mode to compete your friends.


Please vote for us on STEAM GREENLIGHT. Your vote has a power to release game on STEAM for other players!

   





   


   The Maze is a first person survival game set in a twisted, dark maze like world. Players mission is to survive and find portal to get out of maze. But there can be only one survivor...

Our goal is to offer intense, exciting, gripping and scary experience for players.

The Maze environment is not just corners and walls. There is something more. Something ancient, terrifying and living.




   


SINGLEPLAYER AND MULTIPLAYER:

Are you going to make some good time records and watching how friends are trying to beat them. Or go online and be the one and only survivor! At launch the game will feature SURVIVAL mode. That means players will spawn at different locations in maze and try to find a way out without getting killed. Each player probably has a piece of information about location of portal - so you are hunter and you will be hunted!

CHALLENGING GAMEPLAY:

Behave recklessly and you end up dead. Waiting around and you will lose. Choose the best balance of these two and you will survive.

ENVIRONMENT:

Harsh environment can be your friend. Use ancient ruins and pillars to hide from the enemy.

Remember that this maze is twisted and living thing. It can change locations of walls and items... So don`t be surprised if your path is blocked by one point.

TRAPS:

Traps are the main threat in this game. They can be underground, hiding in wall, around the corner, basically everywhere. You have to be careful not to run into them. Some of them trying to slow you down but others are deadly!

ENEMIES:

Not only other players are your enemies. There are something more and terrifying creatures lurking around the maze. 

GRAPHICS:

The Maze offers many graphical and physical features. Depth of field, volumetric fog, collapsing and wind reacting objects and more.


   


Lantern covers your basic lighting needs...


Someone got killed, maybe you can loot something useful from body...


Other player running around and searching portal...


Watch your steps and don't fall into the hole...





   

 

We have been developing The Maze in our spare time for the past several months and we are pleased what we achieved so far. We have been recording night sounds, camping in the woods and so on to get best results. But sad thing is our saving are running out and that means contract work which is not good for developing progress.

To finish The Maze and bring you this thrilling experience we need more resources working on it full time. That`s why we need the funds to keep us going on and focusing 100% on game.

Game is planned to released late Spring 2015 on Steam.




   


Your support is extremely important for us. Every euro/dollar is accounted for finishing the game.

Here is the approximate cost breakdown:





   











   


We are capable of delivering The Maze and even more. There is always a possibility that the game will be delayed due to technical problems, unforeseen circumstances or us wanting to polish and optimize the game more. We are working full time to finish the game as soon as possible.




   


ON WHAT PLATFORM WILL THE MAZE BE RELEASED AND WHEN?

Our main platform is Windows. Currently there is no console support planned, but who knows right? If all goes well, we will be able to release the game around late Spring 2015 on STEAM.

ONCE AGAIN, WHATS ABOUT MULTIPLAYER?

The Maze will support full network experience. Create and manage your own server – your game is visible for all the people in game servers lobby. Use private server option and people can use your IP to connect in game. Or just sit down with friends and use LAN option. Also there will be anticheat system what protects from most common cheats.

ARE THERE DIFFERENT GAME MODES IN MULTIPLAYER?

Game will release with only survivor game mode. But we have some cool ideas for teamwork and it will be released later.

WILL THIS GAME SUPPORT OCULUS RIFT?

We love that idea and think it may be whole new gaming level with Oculus Rift. Sadly at the moment we don't have it. But we seriously consider this support in the future!

WHEN WILL I GET MY REWARDS?

Physical perks will be delivered mid Spring 2015. Game itself of course when its ready. Some digital perks may be sent to you sooner.

ARE THERE ANY WEAPONS IN GAME?

You can use your flashlight to knock down other players for the moment. With light boost you can scare away maze creatures. No other weapons are planned at the moment, but that may be change.

WHATS THE IDEA OF THE GAME?

Idea is to survive and find portal to get out of the maze. But that's not a easy task to do. There are other players, traps and creatures. Each game is kind of unique, because maze randomize every time, places around traps and items. Actually some changes will be take place right middle of the game!

CAN I CUSTOMIZE MY CHARACTER?

The Maze don't include character customization. But players can choose between MALE or FEMALE character.



ALL QUESTIONS AND IDEAS ARE WELCOME AND CAN BE SENT TO:
info@TwoRobotsStudio.com

story:
Strafeman is a supernatural action shooter that is inspired heavily by the 1980´s and the 1990´s arcade games. It  features rail first person and third person game modes with dark, stylish aesthetics and experimental gameplay.

It is currently in development (playable) and the release target is Summer 2014, for PC, Mac Os, Linux and depending on funds, android consoles (Nvidia Shield and Ouya), tablets and phones.


                       

             

Game features:

  • Two game modes : on-rails firs person  and 3rd person shooter
  • 2 characters, 2 player cooperative competitive game
  • Noir, stylized visuals
  • 10 levels of action, divided in different scenarios.
  • Original Sound Track - John 3 : 14


                    


This is Carlos Palanysamy and I have been always flirting with the game industry, but never dedicated to it full time. IT guy by day, I dedicate myself to game development in my free time. Also, I am an accomplished cartoonist, tattoo designer and 2d/3d animator, which helps me to do this game single-handedly.





I started this game after a session of playing old spectrum 128k games. And after a year now, working on it weekends and nights, the game is playable, not only single player, but also cooperative hot seat.

These are some concept art images I did about a year ago. Basic enemy Imp:

Then, made a orthographical design to model on it:

Modelling result (High Poly) :

Finally rigged and animated:





And the exactly same process for the rest of the enemies.

The premise of the game is the old  good (or half-good) vs evil. I had to write a plot, simple one , and a main character. I love flamenco music and am quite interested in gipsy (spanish gipsy) culture, so I thought of making a story about supernatural gipsy against an evil, monstrous, noir world. Specifically, a gipsy character whose power comes from mighty tattoes and religious stamps. I started designing the main character having in mind famous spanish flamenco dancers (for instance Joaquín Cortés)

Early concepts:

More advanced design of him:

as I was progressing with the game, I thought it has to have some pretty nice flamenco metal music and a main character with a strong, remarkable presence. And because the game features a cooperative multiplayer mode, I designed a second character:

Regarding the game mechanics, Strafeman features two game modes depending if the level is mainly indoors or outdoors : on-rails first person camera that moves depending on different events triggered by the player (who controls the cursor gun sight with mouse or gamepad/joystick) and a third person camera where you can control the character.

This is a picture of early game development (year ago):

A more recent picture:


As for weapons, I made a 20-bullet revolver gun as the main weapon, a shotgun as secondary weapon, a knife for melee attacks and for the third person game mode I include a rocket launcher.


Besides these "conventional" weapons, I wanted to add some magic to all this. There are some religious images, "estampitas", quite common in Spain, that I found interesting to have them as vehicle to magic power. I reinterpreted these religious images in a more gothic, darker images. Examples of Strafeman's "estampitas":

Bullet time spell


As for levels, the game will have around 10 levels divided in different scenarios. There are 2 kinds of levels, indoors and outdoors. Indoors are on-rails first person game mode and the latter are third person game mode.

Early level prototype




All this was made single-handedly with great effort and poor social life, and that iss why I want you to be part of this, helping me in this adventure by making a pledge, telling your friends about this game. Your help will speed up the development, make it better and available in different platforms!




I have been working on this game for 1 year now, in my free time and weekends,  when not in my day job, resulting in a poor social life. I want this game to be a good experience for the old and the new player. For the old ones so they can revive good childhood moments at the arcades, and for the young ones to let them try things other than the Triple A fps and conventional 3rd person shooters.

With your help, I can make this game better, by adding original music track (metal flamenco), animation clips, technology and advanced gameplay. Your contributions will make it easier for me to release the game in more platforms(pc, mac, android), where I have special interest in Nvidia Shield.


Also, the money will be used for hardware and software licensing costs and to provide contributors unforgetable rewards with their kind donations.

I have a clear vision and plan about this game and I will be eternally grateful for your interest in being part of this project. You can also help this project by getting the word out!

I want to reward all contributors with unique, memorable rewards for taking part in this project.

                      

                      

                      

                      

                      

                      

                      

                      

                      

                      

At the release  of the game I will hold a party in Brno, Czech Republic. Every contributor is invited to meet me and party hard in one of the most lovely cities in central europe. Travel expenses not covered.

story:
Hello everyone!
We are a Team of Heroes Of The Storm's new MOBA home Blizzard. The reason we are here is to ask for help to start a competitive team of eSports.
The costs are to face are many and they are our only real limit, but with your help we want to overcome this obstacle and conquer step by step the world stage eSports!

That is why we ask you to help the purchase of mobile platforms for the tournaments in LAN and buying jerseys and everything you need in order to be taken seriously!

The eSports are slowly taking relevance in the world sports scene, and with your help we want to be there too.

What you can give in return?

Thanks public with your name on our website, custom signatures with graphics of the team, and for the major donors official jerseys of the team with our signatures.

Goal list :

$ 500: shirts and sweatshirts for the team;

$ 12,500: portable platforms for tournaments in LAN for the team;

$ 15,000: participation in national and European events for the team;


perk list:

$125 Team Esport jersey 

Official team eSports Jersey


_____________________________________________________________________________


$150  Athlete Hoodie (Jacket)

The official team Athlete Hoodie

_____________________________________________________________________________


$350 Team Member Full Geared

1 x Official team Athlete Hoodie (Jacket) 1x Official team Athlete Jersey 1x Official team Mousepad




the picture is just an example, the final model might vary.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute thats fine ^^ you can help by:

  • Following the stream at Twich Channel click here
  • Following the facebook page at click here
  • Spreading the word about it :D
  • Share the link of fundraising

Thank you all so much from the bottom of my heart!

You are all amazing people

Regards

Blood Moon Team <3


www.bloodmoonteam.eu

story:
World of Daedwin

A 7,000 x 7,000 custom made world is in the making by talented terraformers and builders to provide players vast lands to explore! The world is built by our own build team and supporting build teams. View the world map here.

Character System - Nations

Upon joining the server players will have chosen their nation. Nations will provide players with abilities at the same time as they balance out PvP to get rid of nasty harassment and abuse! Current nations:

  • Farhelm (Viking)
  • Drakmar (Orc)
  • Alzeria (Elf)
  • Voronia (Human)

Classes and Disciplines

Our classes and disciplines are carefully thought out to provide each player with unique skills and when fighting monsters they will gain experience and discover even more skills! They will also gain skillpoints when leveling which they can spend in specializations! Current classes:

  • Warrior
  • Elementalist
  • Hunter
  • Rogue
  • Nocturne
  • Divine

Items and Mobs

The monsters you can fight in Daedwin are custom made and can even use skills just like players! They are smart and challanging, but they will also provide players with weapons and armors. The server will feature over 1000 custom items!

Economy

Every player will be able to recieve coins dropping from mobs, trading with eachother or trading with a npc merchant! The system automatically converts your coins into higher valued ones right in your inventory to cut down on space!

About Us

The Daedwin team consists of motivated and hard working people all hoping to create the best playing experience possible. The team have over 2 years of experience with running Minecraft servers and can handle a community with ease at the same time as they provide the server with new features. Everything on the server will be custom shaped after ours AND the communities’ desires.

Daedwin was started by Marwzoor & Deminth in a belief of a brighter future for RPG gaming.

Pledge

Donations will allow us to launch the server and add more features than those that we have already developed. The basic cost for keeping the server up and running will be $60 USD / month although we will expand if we recieve more donations, because they will all be given solely to the server! Other expenses include running a forum integrated site (http://daedwin.net) and advertising.

Donation Goals: 

$150 – The Project will be funded and the server will launch (1 December)! 

$200 – Lootable treasure chests will be added and players will be able to find them all over the world.

$400 – The server is guaranteed to be funded for 5 months and player owned mounts will be added.

$600 – Player owned realms will be developed and all backers recieve 1 additional month of Premium!

$1,000 - Dungeons with puzzles and bosses will be developed into the world.

$1,500 – A new custom made world with dungeons and all features of the regular world and more will be developed!

$2,000 – Quests developed and will be available in all existing worlds.

Additional: The max amount of slots will be increased over time depending on funds available.

story:
PokEdit Pocket

PokEdit.com wants to bring its infamous Pokemon Editor to the App Store.

Our mobile App will do the following:

  • Send Pokemon to DS/3DS games wirelessly.
  • Create Pokemon you can put in the Pokemon Bank.
  • Make the entire process smooth and easy.
We've already made a beast Editor at PokEdit.com. We want bring that same functionality to iOS. We will strive to add on Pokemon X and Y support too. And we'll continue to make our Editor and GTS service better and better!

Why we need your help!

We gotta pay for iPhones and iPads to test our code. We also have to pay for development costs, Apple Fees, server hosting, and more. We're not just looking for free hand outs though. We're willing to give back! Here is what you'll receive by donating to our fund:

  • Everyone who donates will get on "the list". That's right! You'll have your name or handle put on a founders list! People on this list could get secret benefits in the future too.
  • People that go the distance and donate at least 5 dollars or more will get the actual App!
  • If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still go to the same place. It will just take much longer to get there. :(

Here's the perk packages that we're offering:

$1 Bidoof Package
Chip in a buck! This will get your name pasted onto the PokEdit Pocket's Founder Page. You'll get to feel really good about helping this project become a reality and you'll get to hang out with a bidoof!
$2 Ash Package
Pitch in 2 dollars and feel twice as good! You'll get named dropped higher than those in the Bidoof Package and get to feel twice as special. You'll be a real winner... just like Ash!
$5 Trainer Red Package
Be cool like Red! You will get the App on the 3rd release. You'll get 5 PokEdit Dollars which can be used just like cash in PokEdit's store. You'll also get 5 blue and 5 red 1st generation Wii Straps. Can also be used to look cool when used with your iPhone!
$10 Gary Oak
Gary Oak got 10 badges in Kanto by donating 10 dollars to this fund! You get 10 PokEdit Dollars. You'll also get the PokEdit App on second release and you'll get 10 red and 10 blue 1st generation Wii straps. You'll also be a little higher on The List than the Red Package.
$15 Elite Champion
The Elite Champion Package is close to perfection. You'll get the PokEdit App on first release. You'll get 15 PokEdit dollars to spend like cash in the PokEdit Store. You get 15 red and 15 blue straps and you'll be at the second highest position on the founders list!
$25 PokEdit Prime Package
This is the top package. You're actually the best person ever. You'll get the App on first release. You get 25 PokEdit Dollars and you'll get 50 first generation Wii straps (25 red and 25 blue). You'll also get the top spot on the founder list.

PokeImpact

This App will change lives. Imagine getting a legit Arceus or Genesect from a App on your phone. Seriously, this will be amazing:

  • Legal Pokemon! We'll work hard to ensure the Pokemon are compatible with Pokemon Bank and Pokemon X and Y.
  • We already have a great track record with our PokEdit.com Editor. Our App will deliver just as high results!

If you can't donate.

Some people can't give us money (even though it's beans). That's fine, but at least help us out in other ways if you can:

  • Go to our website, make and account and become active there! It helps us and you'll end up having a great time!
  • Get your Pokemon News from PokEdit.com!
  • Tell your Friends and Family about PokEdit.com and this Indygogo campaign!
  • Like us on Facebook, Twitter and anything else!

And there ya go! Let's make this project a reality.

Because of the way the iOS promotions work, we can only give 50 Apps out to you guys for "free" per release (via Promo Codes). 5 dollar donation will get the App for free on 3rd release (could be within a few weeks to months), 10 dollar donations will get the App on 2nd release, 15 and 25 dollar donations will get the App on launch

All of the gifts will be sent as soon as possible after this campaign ends (besides the free version of the App which depends on it's release date and when we can get out newer versions).

THE LIST (founders list)

The List will show everyone who made this App possible. It will be online and will be available for view as long as PokEdit is around. You will forever be a legend. The more you donate to this fund, the higher your ranking will be on the list too.

PokEdit Pocket
		


		PokEdit.com wants to bring its infamous Pokemon Editor to the App Store.
	

		Our mobile App will do the following:
	

Send Pokemon to DS/3DS games wirelessly.
Create Pokemon you can put in the Pokemon Bank.
Make the entire process smooth and easy.


		We've already made a beast Editor at PokEdit.com. We want bring that same functionality to iOS. We will strive to add on Pokemon X and Y support too. And we'll continue to make our Editor and GTS service better and better!
	





			Why we need your help!
		


		We gotta pay for iPhones and iPads to test our code. We also have to pay for development costs, Apple Fees, server hosting, and more. We're not just looking for free hand outs though. We're willing to give back! Here is what you'll receive by donating to our fund:
	

Everyone who donates will get on "the list". That's right! You'll have your name or handle put on a founders list! People on this list could get secret benefits in the future too.
People that go the distance and donate at least 5 dollars or more will get the actual App!
If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still go to the same place. It will just take much longer to get there. :(


		Here's the perk packages that we're offering:
	





$1 Bidoof Package

				Chip in a buck! This will get your name pasted onto the PokEdit Pocket's Founder Page. You'll get to feel really good about helping this project become a reality and you'll get to hang out with a bidoof!
			







$2 Ash Package

				Pitch in 2 dollars and feel twice as good! You'll get named dropped higher than those in the Bidoof Package and get to feel twice as special. You'll be a real winner... just like Ash!
			







$5 Trainer Red Package

				Be cool like Red! You will get the App on the 3rd release. You'll get 5 PokEdit Dollars which can be used just like cash in PokEdit's store. You'll also get 5 blue and 5 red 1st generation Wii Straps. Can also be used to look cool when used with your iPhone!
			







$10 Gary Oak

				Gary Oak got 10 badges in Kanto by donating 10 dollars to this fund! You get 10 PokEdit Dollars. You'll also get the PokEdit App on second release and you'll get 10 red and 10 blue 1st generation Wii straps. You'll also be a little higher on The List than the Red Package.
			







$15 Elite Champion

				The Elite Champion Package is close to perfection. You'll get the PokEdit App on first release. You'll get 15 PokEdit dollars to spend like cash in the PokEdit Store. You get 15 red and 15 blue straps and you'll be at the second highest position on the founders list!
			







$25 PokEdit Prime Package

				This is the top package. You're actually the best person ever. You'll get the App on first release. You get 25 PokEdit Dollars and you'll get 50 first generation Wii straps (25 red and 25 blue). You'll also get the top spot on the founder list.
			







			PokeImpact
		


		This App will change lives. Imagine getting a legit Arceus or Genesect from a App on your phone. Seriously, this will be amazing:
	

Legal Pokemon! We'll work hard to ensure the Pokemon are compatible with Pokemon Bank and Pokemon X and Y.

story:
Get Jeff to Paizocon 2013!

I'm a longtime gamer that got his foot in the door writing for the industry at last year's Paizocon. Since then I've been writing for Louis Porter Jr. Design's NeoExodus line. In fact, I was made head writer for NeoExodus back in February. I've won the Lost Spell held by Kobold Press and was chosen as an alternate for this year's RPG Superstar contest from Paizo. (I've got a running list of my published work, with links to the product pages, here: http://paizo.com/people/Shadowborn) On this front, it was a pretty good year.

On other fronts, sadly, not so much. My partner and I have suffered numerous financial setbacks. At this point, we're living paycheck to paycheck and slowly working ourselves out of the hole. Kat is my number one fan and the biggest supporter of my writing career that I could ask for. However, there's no way feasible way we can swing a trip this year. So, in order to ensure I can get there, I'm asking for help from you good people.

At the last convention I learned a lot from panels that were held on all aspects of the gaming industry, and even more from just talking to people like Louis Porter Jr. over drinks. I made some great contacts and got myself on the path. I'd like to repeat that success this year. Both my publisher and creative director will be there, and a face-to-face meeting over the future of the NeoExodus line would go a long way towards moving the company forward. Also, a lot of big names in the industry will be there, along with representation from some of the strongest third party publishers: Dreamscarred Press, Legendary Games, Frog God Games, Super Genius Games, and of course the people from Paizo themselves. It's a small convention, and those attending are well connected with one another and the industry. With your help, I can connect with those people, learn from them, and receive opportunities from them to let my work shine. In time, I want my name to be right up there with them in terms of recognition and achievements. This is where you come in.

Your generous donations will go to the following:

  • Airfare to and from the convention
  • Hotel stay for 3 nights (I don't need a whole room to myself, so if I'm funded I'll also actively seek out another convention-goer or two that need a room and share it with them, gratis, to spread the love.)
  • A three day con badge and a seat at the banquet (where all the juicy announcements on Paizo products for the upcoming year are announced)
  • Necessities (food and minor costs like printing materials to run a scheduled game)

If you contribute I'll be providing various rewards ranging from my heartfelt gratitude, to firsthand information on new products revealed at Paizocon, to electronic copies of the various gaming products I have written (generously provided by LPJ Design), as well as new projects that will be finished later this year. Some of you can even get an original adventure written by me using ideas that you provide.

Funds over and above my goal will go first and foremost to ensuring that the forthcoming pdf products will be of the best quality possible for my contributors. If enough money is raised, print-on-demand versions may be available.

If I don't reach my goal, all contributors will still receive their promised rewards. If I get enough for the convention badge and banquet ticket, but not the travel funds, I'll see about arrangements to pitch in gas money for any con-goers passing through Spokane by car on their way. My publisher and creative director offered to put me in their room in a pinch as well. Not ideal, but a sleeping bag on the floor is better than nothing.

If you can't contribute, please help out by spreading the word about my campaign, and use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out. Thank you for your interest and support!

Note: Those of you that are gracious enough to contribute at the Exalted Patron status and contributing creatively to the adventure I design will of course be receiving due credit as contributors in the front matter.

Update (5/5): I've sweetened the pot a little. Supporters will get 2 Treasures of NeoExodus pdfs that I've written, and Ardent Supporters will receive 4 Treasures of NeoExodus pdfs.

story:
About Me

I am a UMBC graduate with a Bachelors in Animation. I use my computer to work and make a living. I also want to make a new video game - a sequel to (and much better than) my first app, Dr. Voodoo, shown in the gallery. 

Freelancing is a big source of my income. I can no longer do this on my current machine, a 7-year-old Macbook Pro which is slowly giving up on me entirely.

Recent medical bills have caused me to get into some debt. I'm struggling just to pay bills right now.

I need to get a new iMac to work at home. This will cost a total of about $2000, but I'm hoping to raise at least half of that. Every little bit helps.

By donating to my cause, you will be helping an aspiring artist reach her dreams.

Getting a new computer means I can finally create games and apps and all the many design ideas I have had in the past few years that just couldn't be made on my laptop.

About Dr. Voodoo 2

In this game, you are a doctor. Dr. Voodoo. Your mission is to save patients by playing mini-games. If you fail to save them, then they turn into zombies. You must cure them with your medical and magical prowess before they infect you, too. Play continues until a patient becomes a zombie. Your score is then entered on a high score list. Your overall goal is to beat your own scores, but with the aide of GameCenter, you will have achievements to unlock as well.

What I Need & What You Get

I've had some hard times recently and because of medical bills and other fiascos, my budget is tight and I can't afford to do this alone. I need $2000 for a new iMac, but am hoping to get at least half that from this campaign. If I find more work and stretch myself to insanity, I might be able to afford the rest.

My next game is already in the works but I need a new iMac to complete it. It will hopefully be releasing in January 2014, depending on when I can get a new computer. It will be a sequel to my first app, Dr. Voodoo. The new game will be of much better quality, with more immersive gameplay and better graphics. I have added some game art for Dr. Voodoo 2 in the gallery.

Here's what you get for helping me:

  • $5 or more will get a personalized thank you from me
  • $10 or more will get a copy of my new game, when it releases, created on the iMac, and a thank you note
  • $25 or more will get your name in the credits of the game, a copy of the game, and a thank you note
  • $35 or more will get a 4"X6" print of game art, your name in the credits of the game, a copy of the game, and a thank you note
  • $50 or more will get chocolate chip cookies, your name in the credits of the game, a copy of the game, and a thank you note
  • $75 or more will get a personal "Thank You" on the game's website and a LIMITED EDITION 8"x10" print of game art, signed by the development team (my helpful friends), your name in the credits of the game, a copy of the game, and a thank you note - CAN BE HAND DELIVERED IF YOU LIVE NEAR BALTIMORE, MD - (hugs optional but offered)
  • $100 or more will get 4 cakes in jars, your name in the credits of the game, a copy of the game, and a thank you note
  • And finally, if you donate $150 or more, send me a photo and you'll get an 8"x10" sketch of yourself, a personal "Thank You" on the game's website and a LIMITED EDITION 8"x10" print of game art, signed by the development team (my helpful friends), your name in the credits of the game, a copy of the game, and a thank you note - CAN BE HAND DELIVERED IF YOU LIVE NEAR BALTIMORE, MD - (hugs optional but offered)

Even if I don't reach my goal here, all the proceeds will still go toward buying the iMac and making the game.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please tell others of my need for help. Share, tweet, blog - anything.

If you have questions, please email me at datapike@gmail.com

story:
For more than a decade Automags.org has been the meeting place for paintballers from around the world. Their shared knowledge and history is preserved in the thousands of posts on the website.

This project seeks to move the website off its original dedicated server which is on its last legs to a new permanent home on a shared sever with updated software. The funding is also required to move the Airgun Designs store and homepage.

The ongoing access to the forum by paintball players now and into the future is the perk for this project.
story_txt:
For more than a decade Automags.org has been the meeting place for paintballers from around the world. Their shared knowledge and history is preserved in the thousands of posts on the website.
This project seeks to move the website off its original dedicated server which is on its last legs to a new permanent home on a shared sever with updated software. The funding is also required to move the Airgun Designs store and homepage.
The ongoing access to the forum by paintball players now and into the future is the perk for this project.

story:
• Amino is a game of combining nucleotide cards to create amino acids. Each amino acid card has a points value and first player to score 30 points wins. Games take anywhere from 15-30 minutes for 2-4 players. The game can be played in four “modes” that encompass both competitive and co-operative play.
  • The campaign is looking for £500 to pay for a small print run to allow us to send out games for demonstration and review.
  • The focus of the campaign is the basic Amino deck of 55 Cards; 20 amino acids, 32 nucleotides and 3 player aids/rules.
  • 2 further expansions are in testing right now “RNA” and “Proteins”. Both would add new cards to the game as well as create new modes of play and assist in learning the concepts behind them.
  • The nature of the information on the cards means it is suitable for ANY educational curriculum on the planet that includes the study of genetics. Click here for a list covering the UK, Ireland, USA and both the International and European Baccalaureates
  • Weyrell Ltd is a company founded by Darren Barber with the support of the East Lothian council and Social Enterprise in East Lothian. It's goal is to produce STEM based games and generate additional resources for STEM subjects and research in Schools.


Welcome to my small campaign! My name is Darren and I hope you will take a bit of time to read about my plans for a card game that teaches both children and adults about genetics. My goal is to be able to produce an initial print run of the game and send it out to interested parties for both demonstration and review.

In May of this year I founded Weyrell Ltd. This company, envisaged as a social enterprise, Has received great support of the East Lothian Council and Social Enterprise in East Lothian. It's goal is to produce STEM based games and generate additional funds for STEM subjects and research in Schools. It is still very much early days for the company but we have great plans and a number of amazing products, 12 as of writing, which are both fun and educational.

The idea for our first game, Amino, came out of a news report about GMO food I watched with my young son. It invariably resulted in a lot of questions from him, questions requiring more and more detailed answers… together with lots of post-it notes. I thought it easiest to look around for a suitably STEM based game for kids. Finding none I resolved to make my own.

How is Amino played?

In terms of the basic game each player begins with four nucleotide cards and one amino acid card. The game starts with the youngest player and moves clockwise. Each player can either play the DNA Codons required (see point 9 on the image below) or swap one or more of their hand for new cards. Once a player has "sequenced" their amino acid they draw another. This continues and players keep track of the points value of the amino acids they have made. The first player to get to 30 points wins. 

Of course this seemed a bit too "fair" to me in terms of game play. I've therefore added in rules for both stealing cards (base pairs!) from your opponents and being able to force an opponent to discard their entire hand. In addition there are rules for players to be able to get rid of a low scoring amino acid card allowing players to quickly get high scores... if they have the right cards...


It was important for me to try and find the correct balance for the game where it can be used both as an entry point into genetics and also as a valid educational asset. I had originally pitched it as a game for high school students aged 12+ but the inclusion of the colour system allowed me to drop it down into the 8-12 range. As such I have envisioned it as being pitched in three bands;

  • 8-12 Years:  This is where colour matching (DRuMS colour codes), simple addition (up to 30) and game play concepts are used as a platform to discuss genetics, biology and science in general. My son is amazed that all life is made up of long combinations of those four nucleotides.
  • 12-17 Years: As above but bringing in the biological and chemical concepts into regular play by using the different modes of play. It also introduces the language of genetics in terms of the molecule names, chemical formula and molecular models. In terms of the Scottish SQA Curriculum it supports National 5: Cell Biology (4) DNA and the production of proteins and (5) Proteins and Enzymes.

    It also encompasses Higher: DNA and the Genome 1(a) the structure of DNA.

  • 17 Years and over: As above but in reality this is where the game is used as a set of flash cards. Though the game is fun enough on its own to be played at any age. Again within the Scottish SQA Curriculum it supports Advanced Higher: Key area 2 Proteins (b)(i) Amino acid sequence determines  protein structure

Given the factual nature of the topic and the associated biological principles this game can be of use within any educational curriculum in the world that includes genetics.

The £500 is needed for a very small production run of decks that we can send out for review and demonstration. Any funds above that would be used to produce more decks to fulfil backers and/or increase the opportunities of supplying the decks to local schools. The funds raised are broken into three main areas.

  1. Production: We have a printing company lined up to handle the print run with a couple of others identified should any issues occur with the first.
  2. Fulfilment: Having all of the cards produced and ready is great but I will need to be able to ship them safely to the people who bought them. As shipping is included part of the total raised will cover that.
  3. Admin: i.e. the cost of the funding platform, PayPal fees and the time/calls/ communication needed to make this all happen.

The Deck Format.

Because this campaign is small and focused there is only one perk: the Amino deck itself. It is comprised of:

  • 20 Amino Acid Cards
  • 32 Nucleotide Cards. 8 each of Adenine, Cytosine, Guanine and Thymine
  • 3 Player Aid Cards. These contain the rules including a list of actions a player can make per turn and the details of playing a Stop Codon.

I've done a lot of work to get the game to this point getting a single set of cards printed!



Additional Goals

Because I’m a) only looking for a small amount and b) there are no spare funds hidden within the Perk donation amount I am limited with what I can offer at this time. I will be reviewing it regularly however as I would like to add in additional value for early backers for this game.

As with any creative project the risks revolve around two key "delays"

  • Printing Delays. We have a printer lined up who is a) large b) helpful and c) quick. Understandably this project will be on the lower end of the volume they deal with. The chances of getting bumped are remote but it may happen. 
  • Shipping Delays. Once printed the cards will obviously take a bit of time to get to me. Depending on volume it may take a little while to package and ship the individual rewards.

I should also note that I'm the only person associated with both the production and fulfilment of Amino. I'm a stay-at-home-dad with 2 kids so I'm not exactly 100% available to the project at all times. Should my focus be needed elsewhere communication might be less than perfect.

All of that said, I will be as transparent as possible on all aspects of the project at all times.

If you've made it down this far then you definitely have my thanks!

DB
Weyrell Ltd

and more detailed answers… together with lots of post-it notes. I thought it
easiest to look around for a suitably STEM based game for kids. Finding none I
resolved to make my own.How is Amino played?In terms of the basic game each player begins with four nucleotide cards and one amino acid card. The game starts with the youngest player and moves clockwise. Each player can either play the DNA Codons required (see point 9 on the image below) or swap one or more of their hand for new cards. Once a player has "sequenced" their amino acid they draw another. This continues and players keep track of the points value of the amino acids they have made. The first player to get to 30 points wins.  Of course this seemed a bit too "fair" to me in terms of game play. I've therefore added in rules for both stealing cards (base pairs!) from your opponents and being able to force an opponent to discard their entire hand. In addition there are rules for players to be able to get rid of a low scoring amino acid card allowing players to quickly get high scores... if they have the right cards...It was important for me to try and find the correct balance for the game where it can be used both as an entry point into genetics and also as a valid educational asset. I had originally pitched it as a game for high school students aged 12+ but the inclusion of the colour system allowed me to drop it down into the 8-12 range. As such I have envisioned it as being pitched in three bands;
8-12 Years:  This is where colour
matching (DRuMS colour codes), simple addition (up to 30) and game play concepts are used as a platform to discuss genetics, biology and science in general. My son is amazed
that all life is made up of long combinations of those four nucleotides.

12-17 Years: As above but bringing in the biological and chemical concepts into regular play by using the different modes of play. It also introduces the language of genetics in terms of the molecule names, chemical formula and molecular models. In terms of the Scottish SQA Curriculum it supports National 5: Cell Biology (4) DNA and the
production of proteins and (5) Proteins and Enzymes.

It also encompasses Higher: DNA and the Genome 1(a) the structure of
DNA. 

17 Years and over: As above but in reality this is where the game is used as a set of flash cards. Though the game is fun enough on its own to be played at any age. Again within the Scottish SQA Curriculum it supports Advanced Higher: Key area 2
Proteins (b)(i) Amino acid sequence determines  protein structure

Given the factual nature of the topic and the associated biological principles this game can be of use within any educational curriculum in the world that includes genetics.


The £500 is
needed for a very small production run of decks that we can send out for review and demonstration. Any funds above that would be used to produce more decks to fulfil backers
and/or increase the opportunities of supplying the decks to local schools. The
funds raised are broken into three main areas.

Production: We have a printing
     company lined up to handle the print run with a couple of others identified
     should any issues occur with the first. 
Fulfilment: Having all of the
     cards produced and ready is great but I will need to be able to ship
     them safely to the people who bought them. As shipping is included part of
     the total raised will cover that. 
Admin: i.e. the cost of the
     funding platform, PayPal fees and the time/calls/ communication needed to
     make this all happen.

The Deck
Format. 
Because this campaign is small and focused there is only one perk: the Amino deck itself. It is comprised of:

20 Amino Acid Cards
32 Nucleotide Cards. 8 each of
     Adenine, Cytosine, Guanine and Thymine
3 Player Aid Cards. These
     contain the rules including a list of actions a player can make per turn and the details of playing
     a Stop Codon. 

I've done a lot of work to get the game to this point getting a single set of cards printed!

Additional Goals
Because I’m a)
only looking for a small amount and b) there are no spare funds hidden within
the Perk donation amount I am limited with what I can offer at this time. I will be reviewing it regularly however as I would like to add in additional value for early backers for this game.

As with any
creative project the risks revolve around two key "delays"

Printing Delays. We have a
     printer lined up who is a) large b) helpful and c) quick. Understandably
     this project will be on the lower end of the volume they deal with. The
     chances of getting bumped are remote but it may happen.  
Shipping Delays. Once printed
     the cards will obviously take a bit of time to get to me. Depending on
     volume it may take a little while to package and ship the individual
     rewards.

I should
also note that I'm the only person associated with both the production and fulfilment
of Amino. I'm a stay-at-home-dad with 2 kids so I'm not exactly 100% available
to the project at all times. Should my focus be needed elsewhere communication
might be less than perfect.

All of that said, I will be as transparent as possible on all aspects of the
project at all times.
If you've
made it down this far then you definitely have my thanks!
DBWeyrell Ltd

story:
NIGHT TERRORS PREORDERS - HALLOWEEN 2016

 

 

Welcome to the Night Terrors preorders page. We've created this page in response to the people that've expressed utter horror at missing the first campaign. We're working towards the goal of creating the scariest game ever made - available Halloween 2016. If you’re new to Night Terrors - click here. 

Although we were unsuccessful in our initial funding, what we did raise went to progressing with the software over the last 6 months. In the coming months, we'll start fulfilling our perks.   

With all the recent attention on AR/VR, we thought we should mention a principle purpose of this project is to demonstrate immersive gaming doesn't take deep pockets and big headsets. Through creativity and ingenuity, we are going to prove that AR games can be an affordable, quality experience, available to all.

 

Night Terrors will launch for $5.99 on iTunes and the Android Store. 


 

              As featured on

 

             Technology and Effects




We're using practical effects as opposed to CGI - In Night Terrors, every augmented element is photographed in order to compost elements and match lighting in the players' environment. With control over the devices LED, the lighting conditions of both element and environment can be manipulated to create a perfect, extraordinarily frightening match.
 
We've built a system that understands where the walls, ceiling and floors exist, making the ghost placement much more realistic and believable to the player using feature totally new to augmented reality experiences on mobile devices.

Point-source modeling, environment filtering and intensity scanning are all used in order to build a clean map only from walls and light. Gyroscope sensor data is used as a starting point, ceilings and floors are established, giving way to a one-of-a-kind experience for players.  Check out the video below for a demonstration. 



All  of the above mentioned features combine to create depth data and compute player position giving elements in the game unparalleled realism. When used together, we're able to build a map of the players environment.We can create a breathtakingly scary experience for players - one that will make you forget and question what it is you're playing, and how the system knows what it does.


COMMON QUESTIONS

 
Q: What happens with the layout data once my house is fully mapped? 
A: We have no interest in the data regarding the layout of your house. There will be rules of use in the app's info, and we'll clearly spell out that we will not collect the data that's stored locally on your copy of Night Terrors - we can't even get to it.  We're using the technique because its the most effective way in order for the system to place elements logically - there are lots of ghost and "AR" apps that overlay images regardless of placement, we aren't going to be another one. True immersion requires strategic placement of elements in different areas to where the mind can make sense of what's happening in terms of relevant space and time. 
 
Q: Why are you raising money again? 
A: Good question. While our first campaign was successful in theory, we didn't get to the number we were shooting for. And in all honesty, even that number was going to be tight in terms of what we had left. We raised 67%, and that's lasted us a long time, but the money from preorders will now go solely to props and finishing this project to the level we want to. We'll have many more updates from here on out, as now the visual part of the project will start coming to life.
 
 

Q: I'd like to purchase a higher perk from the old campaign, is this still possible?

A: Yes, this is still possible. If you would like to claim an old perk campaign or donate a higher amount of your choosing then please email - novum.analytics@gmail.com before pledging.

 

Q:  How will the software respond to smaller spaces - One-room apartments, studios, etc? 
A: We've gotten this question a lot. We don't foresee experience-interrupting issues with this, just a lot of turning around. The beta tests that will begin in a couple months will have a significant impact on how well the system will perform in smaller spaces, as we're hoping our backers with smaller spaces will be willing to work together on making the experience enjoyable, no matter the size of the space. Once we figure out the diversity of spaces we have to test with, we may reach out looking for more people with studio/1 bedroom apartments, 
 
Q: When will this be available for Android devices? 
A:  Definitely one of our most asked questions - Night Terrors will absolutely be available on Android. As we've extended our launch date, we hope that both versions will be available around the same time. Truthfully, we can't give an exact date for this, although it should be noted that we understand the size and significance of the Android market. Our goal is to make affordable AR games for all devices. Our natural language programming knowledge is in Objective C, C++c, and C for iOS. (If there are Android devs out there - please reach out!) We can guarantee this title will be available on Android devices. It will take a significantly greater amount of testing (because of all the variation in devices), and we'll have to get some Java development help, but we're looking forward to working with our Android backers and developers in order to get this working on all platforms. 
 
Q: This has been delayed a couple times now - can you guys really do this? 
A: Yes, we can really do this. We admittedly shot a little high on our initial estimates as building out the software to where we're comfortable with it has been a tedious process. We will have a tech demo followed by a 1-2 room beta in the coming months. We appreciate everyone bearing with us. As with any type of new technology, time management and estimation on completion is tough. We probably could've given ourselves more leeway, although there were also some issues that caused delays outside of the programming and development. We're working as fast as we can to get this done - we're fully aware of the implications this may have in terms of mobile gaming, and we don't want to release something until we're totally confident it'll be a great experience. 
 
Q: What will be the game's effect on the battery life 
A: The game will have the same effect as watching video media or heavily surfing the Internet.  Abnormal battery drain should not be anticipated. 

We'll post more questions and answers once we start getting more in. The above is what we've been asked the most, and everyone is always welcome to reach out to our gmail, novum.analytics@gmail.com, or support@novumanalytics.com if there are more questions. 
 
As we've selected Indiegogo In Demand, this page will remain active beyond the two week run. We're incredibly thankful for our base of support, and we can promise everyone will not be disappointed. We'll be adding more to this page as it comes, and will also be updating our past campaign for those backers concurrently. 
Thank you so much for your support.
 
-NOVUM

story:
Bridge Commander 2 is a Fan-Made game, it is in no way Affiliated with CBS, Totally Games, or Paramount. TM & © 2010 Paramount Pictures. All rights reserved. Star Trek: TNG and related marks are trademarks of Paramount Pictures in the U.S. and/or other countries.

Based off the original "STAR TREK: Bridge Commander" Bridge Commander 2 seeks to redefine space simulation games with an immense amount of detail and worlds to explore, players will be able to land on planets, venture through solar systems, scan nebulae, chase down maquis raiders, and defend whichever race they choose to call home, which includes but is not limited to:

The Federation / Starfleet (Civilian)
The Klingon Empire
The Cardassian Union
The Romulan Star Empire
The Dominion

And many more races as time progresses and as funding is more successful we will add more races to the game.

Bridge Commander 2 is a sort of spiritual successor to "STAR TREK: Bridge Commander", the original Bridge Commander had lots of good ideas, however, they were incomplete, and the game lacked much, including but not limited to: Dynamic environments, realistic planets, planetary rings, Immense environments, such as large areas of space, and many more graphical and engine features that most people take advantage of in today's technological world. It is not a 1:1 remake, but it's an attempt to improve upon the idea of Bridge Commander.  

My goals are simple, finish the AI Architecture, get weapons completed (mainly beam weapons at this point), finish shields, finish the warp drive systems, make more star systems, implement multiplayer, and try to get a development build out within the next 2 months, to do this i will need to hire programmers.

The current status of the project is estimated around here..: Models/Textures: 50%

Programming: 35%

Quests: 0%

Universe (Planets, stars, systems, etc...): 5% (it's a very large and detailed universe)

a rough estimate would place the game in 100% completion in late 2014 if funding goals are met and i am able to hire some help.  

BC2 features things never before completed in other space simulation games, for example: Land on planets you or the AI can do the work on this one Fly through planets rings, destroy asteroid fields and mine their contents. 

BC2 will not limit you to only a military career in whichever government you choose (Federation, Cardassian, Romulan, Etc...) but you will be able to be a civilian just mining precious metals, or trading, or whatever it is you want to do, ships will feature soft-body deformation, you'll be able to rip your ship apart if you really want to, or if you don't want to, just put a torpedo through the hull of your enemy.  

The "STAR TREK" Intellectual Property is not directly related to this project, however we have obtained legal permission from CBS themselves, namely their legal department to pursue this game and fully develop it, we even have a few publishers lined up once the project is in a more complete (nearly done) status, so there are no risks of lawsuits.

As with any programming project, there are inherent risks involved with writing and testing all of the various gameplay elements that we will be using to make Bridge Commander 2 a unique and fun experience when it is finished. As developers, we have several years of programming experience as well as real life work experience that we believe gives us an edge that an amateur game programmer might not normally have. We are used to setting goals and meeting deadlines, and bringing others together with similar skill-sets and interests to compliment our own.

Finding a publisher and getting copy rights to such a popular franchise. However, given the overall quality of our game and our idea of what the finished product will be we have no doubt that it will have great appeal to any game publisher. Some unique challenges we face are implementing a highly-engaging story and single player campaign, a robust and reliable network play system, and an efficient game engine that will run on a wide variety of personal computer hardware. We will be able to surmount these problems with our unique set of skills and our determination and enthusiasm for our game.

story:
Welcome to Arcana: Sands of Destiny crowdfunding campaign. Arcana: Sands of Destiny is a hidden object adventure game where you will explore mysterious and magical Egypt at the beginning of the 20th century. We have an intriguing story for you about Jenny Hopkins facing an ancient evil that has been awakened in the scorching deserts of Egypt and now threatens the whole world.

 We have been working hard on our first game for a year and now are ready to share with you some of our videos and screenshots from the game.

 From gamers for gamers. We love playing hidden object games and hope this game will bring fun and joy to you too.

 Many hidden object games consist of boring closed environments where players find themselves in haunted, run down houses with thousands of doors where they have to find a list of objects on the screen level after level. In Arcana: Sands of Destiny you will have a completely different experience as you travel across sea, land and air! Interact with other characters, defeat enemies, solve puzzles, complete quests and build your very own palace in your unique style!

  • You will discover 4 ancient realms to explore
  • More than 5 hours of gameplay
  • Enchanting story with beautiful colorful art
  • Interactive animated characters with voiceovers
  • Incredible music and sound effects
  • Hint system to help through your adventure
  • Bonus levels as you find morth objects
  • On top of all this you get to build your very own palace in your own unique style!
                                           Isn't all that worth just 5$ ?

  The game will support all major platforms Windows, Mac, iOS and Android

 Invoke Games is casual game development company founded in 2013 by Vlad Ivanov in Novosibirsk, Russia. We are an international team with talents from all over the world. All of our developers have extensive experience, however, we also welcome new graduates to be a part of our team.

 Our main focus is creating casual games that are easy to learn and fun to play. We are passionate about gaming, and strive to deliver games that are fun and memorable to play.

  • Vlad Ivanov - Founder of Invoke Games, 3d/2d Artist, Programmer. (Previously worked as an artist and animator on the game Antique Mysteries: Secrets of Howard's Mansion)
  • Charlie Armour - Music Composer (Charlie is well known in the indie game community for his talent and passion for writing music for games. He has received countless awards and praise. You can see his works at www.charliearmour.com )
  • Markus Lovadina - Concept Artist (Concept Artist (Markus has worked for many game companies as a lead concept artist. He has a strong understanding of what is needed and a sharp eye. donmalo.deviantart.com)
  • Alina Gurchenko - Painter artist
  • Redd Horrocks - Voiceover actor
  • Bella Swan - Voiceover actor
  • James Scott - Voiceover actor
  • Karen Shuff - Quality assurance

  As you can see we are a small indie team, but we have the experience and determination to create a great game that is fun to play. Also, it's a sign that the money goes where it is needed (we won't spend your money on live game exhibitions events or first class flight tickets).
 However, we will be soon contracting more talent to speed up the development of the game.

  The game is 70% finished, but it still requires more work in areas such as music, sound effects, special video effects and animations in order to be complete and to make it more memorable. With crowd funding we can hire more developers to finish the game and, if we are successful, the estimated release date will be the 25th of June, 2014.

  Being a small team with a limited budget and an ambitious project like ours is hard. It is even harder when the budget runs out while your game is getting closer and closer to the finish line.

 That is why we need your help! In exchange, we are offering you an amazingly low price for this game, exclusively for people who support and trust us here. We will give you Arcana: Sands of Destiny for only $5!

 This is over 60% off of the release price of $14.99!   

  • Digital DRM Free copy of the game
  • Wallpaper pack
  • Your name in the credits as a funder

  • Digital DRM Free copy of the game
  • Wallpaper pack
  • Digital strategy guide
  • Exclusive PC beta access
  • MP3 sound tracks
  • All concept art
  • Your name in the credits as a funder

  • Digital DRM Free copy of the game
  • Wallpaper pack
  • Digital strategy guide
  • Exclusive PC beta access
  • MP3 sound tracks
  • All concept art
  • Your name in the credits as a funder
  • Fee digital version of our next game!

                          Gold Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
  • Exclusive poster with all characters
  • Set of colorful post cards
  • T-shirt (few other versions will be available for your choice)
  • Your name as an exclusive funder

                   Platinum Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
  • Exclusive 4.7 inch (12 cm) Jenny Hopkins figurine!
  • All of the games we make for the next 10 years!

                      Dimond Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
  • 3 more figurines of main characters in the game!

                              Star Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
  • You in the game as one of the main characters with both your name and your appearance!
  • Plus a figurine of you!

          Co-Executive Producer Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
  • A mention of you as a Co-Executive producer in the game's opening titles
  • Free Lifetime games form Invoke Games!

 It would mean the end of the world as we know it! No, not really :)
Two options:

1. We try to rerun the crowdfunding campaign with even more effort, such as posting banners on Eiffel Tower.

2. We finish the game by ourselves with no budget, but it will take much longer because we all will have to go back to our previous jobs.

 Nevertheless, we hope to reach the crowdfunding goal, since we are strongly committed to the project and we are giving it our best.

 Thank you for your time and please support us! If you can't, well, just spread the word about our game. You never know, maybe your grandma would like it!


Official site : www.arcanasandsofdestiny.com

Company site : www.invokegames.com

Arcana: Sands of Destiny is a hidden object adventure game where you will explore mysterious and magical Egypt at the beginning of the 20th century. We have an intriguing story for you about Jenny Hopkins facing an ancient evil that has been awakened in the scorching deserts of Egypt and now threatens the whole world. We have been working hard on our first game for a year and now are ready to share with you some of our videos and screenshots from the game. From gamers for gamers. We love playing hidden object games and hope this game will bring fun and joy to you too. Many hidden object games consist of boring closed environments where players find themselves in haunted, run down houses with thousands of doors where they have to find a list of objects on the screen level after level. In Arcana: Sands of Destiny you will have a completely different experience as you travel across sea, land and air! Interact with other characters, defeat enemies, solve puzzles, complete quests and build your very own palace in your unique style!
You will discover 4 ancient realms to explore
More than 5 hours of gameplay
Enchanting story with beautiful colorful art
Interactive animated characters with voiceovers
Incredible music and sound effects
Hint system to help through your adventure
Bonus levels as you find morth objects
On top of all this you get to build your very own palace in your own unique style!
                                           Isn't all that worth just 5$ ?  The game will support all major platforms Windows, Mac, iOS and Android Invoke Games is casual game development company founded in 2013 by Vlad Ivanov in Novosibirsk, Russia. We are an international team with talents from all over the world. All of our developers have extensive experience, however, we also welcome new graduates to be a part of our team. Our main focus is creating casual games that are easy to learn and fun to play. We are passionate about gaming, and strive to deliver games that are fun and memorable to play.
Vlad Ivanov - Founder of Invoke Games, 3d/2d Artist, Programmer. (Previously worked as an artist and animator on the game Antique Mysteries: Secrets of Howard's Mansion)
Charlie Armour - Music Composer (Charlie is well known in the indie game community for his talent and passion for writing music for games. He has received countless awards and praise. You can see his works at www.charliearmour.com )
Markus Lovadina - Concept Artist (Concept Artist (Markus has worked for many game companies as a lead concept artist. He has a strong understanding of what is needed and a sharp eye. donmalo.deviantart.com)

Alina Gurchenko - Painter artist

Redd Horrocks - Voiceover actor
Bella Swan - Voiceover actor

James Scott - Voiceover actor

Karen Shuff - Quality assurance
  As you can see we are a small indie team, but we have the experience and determination to create a great game that is fun to play. Also, it's a sign that the money goes where it is needed (we won't spend your money on live game exhibitions events or first class flight tickets). However, we will be soon contracting more talent to speed up the development of the game.  The game is 70% finished, but it still requires more work in areas such as music, sound effects, special video effects and animations in order to be complete and to make it more memorable. With crowd funding we can hire more developers to finish the game and, if we are successful, the estimated release date will be the 25th of June, 2014.  Being a small team with a limited budget and an ambitious project like ours is hard. It is even harder when the budget runs out while your game is getting closer and closer to the finish line. That is why we need your help! In exchange, we are offering you an amazingly low price for this game, exclusively for people who support and trust us here. We will give you Arcana: Sands of Destiny for only $5! This is over 60% off of the release price of $14.99!   
Digital DRM Free copy of the game
Wallpaper  pack

Your name in the credits as a funder


Digital DRM Free copy of the game

Wallpaper  pack
Digital strategy guide
Exclusive  PC beta access
MP3 sound tracks
All concept art

Your name in the credits as a funder

Digital DRM Free copy of the game
Wallpaper  pack
Digital strategy guide
Exclusive  PC beta access
MP3 sound tracks
All concept art
Your name in the credits as a funder
Fee digital version of our next game!

                          Gold Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
Exclusive poster with all characters 
Set of colorful post cards
T-shirt (few other versions will be available for your choice)
Your name as an exclusive funder
                   Platinum Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
Exclusive 4.7 inch (12 cm) Jenny Hopkins figurine!
All of the games we make for the next 10 years!
                      Dimond Edition includes all of the previous rewards +3 more figurines of main characters in the game!                              Star Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
You in the game as one of the main characters with both your name and your appearance!
Plus a figurine of you!
          Co-Executive Producer Edition includes all of the previous rewards +
A mention of you as a Co-Executive producer in the game's opening titles
Free Lifetime games form Invoke Games!
 It would mean the end of the world as we know it! No, not really :)Two options:1. We try to rerun the crowdfunding campaign with even more effort, such as posting banners on Eiffel Tower.2. We finish the game by ourselves with no budget, but it will take much longer because we all will have to go back to our previous jobs. Nevertheless, we hope to reach the crowdfunding goal, since we are strongly committed to the project and we are giving it our best. Thank you for your time and please support us! If you can't, well, just spread the word about our game. You never know, maybe your grandma would like it! Official site : www.arcanasandsofdestiny.comCompany site : www.invokegames.com

story:
So why does this campaign exist?

Good question. I'm a youtuber of sorts who also likes livestreams and alcohol. This Idea came about when I was streaming and ran out of alcohol for my drinking game. The audience wanted me to keep going but I said I couldn't afford unlimited alcohol. So this was recommended. 

So what are the rules?

This may very depending on the popularity of donating as I don't feel like dying of alcohol poisoning. Right now I'm thinking.

Shots at 2$ 4$ 8$ 10$ 20$ and Double from there resetting after every stream.

But that's more than the cost of the alcohol what happens to the rest of the money?

With any extra money I make I'll be buying new computer/recording equipment. Again the exponentially increasing cost is just so I don't die.

So Where Can I find and watch this glorious man?

Thank you, I'm flattered you'd call me glorious. You can find me stream atwww.Twitch.tv/yessikziiiq and my youtube at www.youtube.com/yessikziiiq.

When do you usually stream? 

This can be a bit sporadic, usually Tuesday and Friday. Although sometimes The heat will stop this.
