story:
Project Summary.

Hi! My name is Phill Routledge and together with Darren O'Brian (my co-driver) We are the founders of Sim Racing Australia  - Australia's premiere multi-platform online sim racing community.

Our online racing community is attempting to bring you the thrills and the spills of the real  Supercars 2015  season  by  bringing  you  our  fictional take  of  the 2015   Supercars touring car category for use in the excellent Stock Car Extreme sim.

This project is not for profit and in keeping with the tradition of 'community made' mods we will be releasing it to the world absolutely free of charge once it's completed.

The mod's working title is "OZ V8" and we invite you all to read on and assist us to make this project a reality!

What Platforms will this mod be released too?

Stock Car Extreme. (Formerly Game Stock Car Extreme).

Firstly the mod will be made available for all current and future owners of the excellent Stock Car Extreme platform. This platform has been chosen primarily because it is by far the best online sim available today that is A) Non subscription and B) Not in a current alpha or beta development state.

Stock Car Extreme is a matured and highly developed sim that today continues to be regularly updated by the company who develop it - Reiza Studios.

The Stock Car Extreme platform offers amazing force feedback, incredible physics and sounds, as well as rock solid multiplayer network code. It also allows gaming communities to easily replicate a real Australian V8 season with all of the Australian race tracks being readily available for download for free.

Our Campaign will include.

  • Studio quality physics and sounds developed by Reiza Studio's. 
  • That's right!! you read this correctly - The physics and sounds for this mod are being developed by Reiza Studio's and licensed to Sim Racing Australia for the purpose of implementation into the OZ V8 mod. For more info please see: http://www.racedepartment.com/threads/ozv8-crowd-fund-project.103435/#post-1973926
  • We are sourcing top quality, highly accurate 3D models for all five Supercar variants (exteriors and interiors) from a highly regarded 3D modeling studio which we have sub contracted. These models will feature no less than 40k external polygon counts - WIP examples shown below;
  • Preview Hi Res renders of our WIP "Ninja Attitude" and "Holding Commando"models.

  • We will also be using the services of a highly skilled car livery painting expert and photo-shop / graphic design expert. Both will be hand picked from the sim community - These cars will look absolutely amazing when painted and placed in game!
  • The magnitude of you're supporting this endeavor is huge!
  • This is a unique project in that it's giving those who can't mod the opportunity too give something back to the sim racing community that has freely given us all so much over the years!
You will be assisting us too put together what we believe could well be the very last of the 'true' Supercars mods solely featuring the wild V8 engines!

    What we need & What you get?

    Breaking it down:

    • You will receive the single best, most accurate Supercar mod that's ever been done!
    • We require $1000usd (which is really not much in a worldwide crowd  funding sense) to get the mod completed and deliver it too you.
    • As shown above we have already started work with our chosen modelling firm on the car models  - But, it goes without saying - the more revenue we can raise the better the finished result will be.
    • This mod will feature the most accurate Supercar physics and sounds you have ever seen because they are being developed by the acclaimed team at Reiza Studio's and we have their full permission to deliver you these physics and sounds.
    • We are offering you all some "investor's perks"   (Please see them to the right hand side of these text's>>)  that  will hopefully  give  you  a tangible reason  to invest  in this project beyond the basic donator support level!
    • If our funding goal is not reached we advise the funds are not delivered to us by Indiegogo. Should this happen, they (Indiegogo), will return all funds you pledge in full back to you -  our supporters / donators.

    The Impact

    We believe this project is valuable not just to you as a contributor but we feel it's of great value too the wider sim racing community that has freely given so much to us all over the years in the form of free mods, tracks and expansion's.

     - This is your chance to give something back to the sim racing community!     -
    - Your chance to participate in something positive -

    Risks & Challenges

    The  only  risk involved  is  the risk  of  the community (you) not getting behind the project.  In which case - if short-funded it simply wont proceed. No harm no foul.

    The challenge is in you having the faith and the belief in us enough to trust that we can deliver on what we aim too with the assistance and guidance of our partners.

    It is with our hand on our hearts we say to you - our intentions are 100% pure.

    As long time user's of the freely shared sim racing mods and tracks developed by many amazing people around the world we want nothing more than to give a little something back to the sim racing community that has given us all so much over the years!

    Other Ways You Can Help?

    You may may also be able to help us beyond just investing;

    • Everyone  is  encouraged  to  get  the  word out  and make some "noise" about our campaign! Think - Gaming  news  websites, on your sim racing  league's  forums / website, & even perhaps the sharing   of  information  about   this   project  via   your personal social  media  feeds such  like your facebook and twitter accounts - Help us get the word out!
    • Be sure to use the Indiegogo "share tools" which are displayed on the OZ V8's indiegogo campaign page right here, this is the easiest way to spread the word via your social media of choice ;)
    • If  you  have  MAD SKILLS we will be looking for willing and enthusiastic collaborator's to assist us with some project jobs such like making awesome renders of our cars for our news release's or perhaps you have a bit of a knack for making amazing video's that can help us advertise.
    • We also seek suitably competent personnel to help us do the paint skins and graphic development for these cars.
    • If you have any MAD SKILLS that you think may add value to the OZV8 project, and if your'e keen on being part of the process of making this mod - We ask you to contact us at admin{@}simracingoz(dot)com !! We absolutely will have need of your valuable skills!
    • Most of all - Please encourage your sim racing mates to check out the project and get behind us!

    We look forwards to your support!

    So in closing - "Lets get this party started! Right now!"

    Yours Sincerely,

    Phill Routledge and Darren O'Brian - Admin's and Founders - www.simracingoz.com
story_txt:
Project Summary.

Hi! My name is Phill Routledge and together with Darren O'Brian (my co-driver) We are the founders of Sim Racing Australia  - Australia's premiere multi-platform online sim racing community.Our online racing community is attempting to bring you the thrills and the spills of the real  Supercars 2015  season  by  bringing  you  our  fictional take  of  the 2015   Supercars touring car category for use in the excellent Stock Car Extreme sim. This project is not for profit and in keeping with the tradition of 'community made' mods we will be releasing it to the world absolutely free of charge once it's completed.The mod's working title is "OZ V8" and we invite you all to read on and assist us to make this project a reality!What Platforms will this mod be released too?
Stock Car Extreme. (Formerly Game Stock Car Extreme).Firstly the mod will be made available for all current and future owners of the excellent Stock Car Extreme platform. This platform has been chosen primarily because it is by far the best online sim available today that is A) Non subscription and B) Not in a current alpha or beta development state. Stock Car Extreme is a matured and highly developed sim that today continues to be regularly updated by the company who develop it - Reiza Studios.The Stock Car Extreme platform offers amazing force feedback, incredible physics and sounds, as well as rock solid multiplayer network code. It also allows gaming communities to easily replicate a real Australian V8 season with all of the Australian race tracks being readily available for download for free.
Our Campaign will include.


Studio quality physics and sounds developed by Reiza Studio's. 
That's right!! you read this correctly - The physics and sounds for this mod are being developed by Reiza Studio's and licensed to Sim Racing Australia for the purpose of implementation into the OZ V8 mod. For more info please see: http://www.racedepartment.com/threads/ozv8-crowd-fund-project.103435/#post-1973926

We are sourcing top quality, highly accurate 3D models for all five Supercar variants (exteriors and interiors) from a highly regarded 3D modeling studio which we have sub contracted. These models will feature no less than 40k external polygon counts - WIP examples shown below;




Preview Hi Res renders of our WIP "Ninja Attitude" and "Holding Commando"models.





We will also be using the services of a highly skilled car livery 
painting expert and photo-shop / graphic design expert. Both will be hand picked from the sim community - These cars will
 look absolutely amazing when painted and placed in game!
The magnitude of you're supporting this endeavor is huge! 

This is a unique project in that it's giving those who can't mod the opportunity too give something back to the sim racing community that has freely given us all so much over the years!
You will be assisting us too put together what we believe could well be the very last of the 'true' Supercars mods solely featuring the wild V8 engines!
  What we need & What you get? Breaking it down: 
You will receive the single best, most accurate Supercar mod that's ever been done! 

We require $1000usd (which is really not much in a worldwide crowd  funding sense) to get the mod completed and deliver it too you. 

As shown above we have already started work with our chosen modelling firm on the car models  - But, it goes without saying - the more revenue we can raise the better the finished result will be.

This mod will feature the most accurate Supercar physics and sounds you have ever seen because they are being developed by the acclaimed team at Reiza Studio's and we have their full permission to deliver you these physics and sounds.
 We are offering you all some "investor's perks"   (Please see them to the right hand side of these text's>>)  that  will hopefully  give  you  a tangible reason  to invest  in this project beyond the basic donator support level!
 If our funding goal is not reached we advise the funds are not delivered to us by Indiegogo. Should this happen, they (Indiegogo), will return all funds you pledge in full back to you -  our supporters / donators.

  The Impact  We believe this project is valuable not just to you as a contributor but we feel it's of great value too the wider sim racing community that has freely given so much to us all over the years in the form of free mods, tracks and expansion's.  - This is your chance to give something back to the sim racing community! -- Your chance to participate in something positive -
  Risks & ChallengesThe  only  risk involved  is  the risk  of  the community (you) not getting behind the project.  In which case - if short-funded it simply wont proceed. No harm no foul.The challenge is in you having the faith and the belief in us enough to trust that we can deliver on what we aim too with the assistance and guidance of our partners. It is with our hand on our hearts we say to you - our intentions are 100% pure. As long time user's of the freely shared sim racing mods and tracks developed by many amazing people around the world we want nothing more than to give a little something back to the sim racing community that has given us all so much over the years!
  Other Ways You Can Help? You may may also be able to help us beyond just investing; 
Everyone  is  encouraged  to  get  the  word out  and make some "noise" about our campaign! Think - Gaming  news  websites, on your sim racing  league's  forums / website, & even perhaps the sharing   of  information  about   this   project  via   your personal social  media  feeds such  like your facebook and twitter accounts - Help us get the word out!


 Be sure to use the Indiegogo "share tools" which are displayed on the OZ V8's indiegogo campaign page right here, this is the easiest way to spread the word via your social media of choice ;)

If  you  have  MAD SKILLS we will be looking for willing and enthusiastic collaborator's to assist us with some project jobs such like making awesome renders of our cars for our news release's or perhaps you have a bit of a knack for making amazing video's that can help us advertise. 

We also seek suitably competent personnel to help us do the paint skins and graphic development for these cars. 

If you have any MAD SKILLS that you think may add value to the OZV8 project, and if your'e keen on being part of the process of making this mod - We ask you to contact us at admin{@}simracingoz(dot)com !! We absolutely will have need of your valuable skills!

Most of all - Please encourage your sim racing mates to check out the project and get behind us!
 
 We look forwards to your support! So in closing - "Lets get this party started! Right now!"Yours Sincerely,Phill Routledge and Darren O'Brian - Admin's and Founders - www.simracingoz.com

story:
So...

I'm just your average Joe, but my name isn't Joe. So I'm just your average *my name* (sorry my mum taught me not to share my name with strangers). Jokes my name is Chris.

Here are the facts.

1. I want an Xbox one
2. Having a baby has removed any gaming fund.
3. My wife has no confidence in YOU! She said there was no way that people I didn't know would buy me an Xbox one. I’m here to protect you good name/s!
4. If I raise the funds she has said she will eat a hat. (I don't have a hat at the moment, so that may become a stretch goal)!

So ye, me want Xbox one and me don’t have the ££.

What's in it for you?

Honestly?
Your mind will be blown with the amazing treats in store for you. From teaspoons to bespoke poems and even maybe paintings from a baby that isn’t old enough to crawl yet!

Let’s be transparent here – I may fail and not reach the target and in that case what happens with your loving donations!!!!!???
Well you will still get your amazing gift/s! You won’t lose out!

Now let’s talk about the target amount. I know it is currently higher than an xbox one. It is that high because the minimum amount “must be greater than, or equal to, £500”
The remaining monies will go to charity! I’ll ask all you guys which charity you would like out of a shortlist and send the ££ their way. Don’t worry I will send you all proof that it has been sent- Remember I’m being transparent, like paper that has soaked up loads of grease. NOM NOM NOM

The Impact

If I reach the goal, the prize, the dream, etc. I will probably cry. Tears of joy over an xbox one joining my household, but also tears of joy for an increased faith in humanity.
I could also save my tears and rub them on your goodies if you’d like.

Risks & Challenges

If I lose to my wife I’ve promised I will eat a shed load of chillies and root ginger.
This will also make me cry. These tears will not be ones of joy.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my super epic unicorn campaign.
    *there are no unicorns involved in this campaign.
  • Indiegogo share tools.

story:
**Our journey doesn't stop when the Indiegogo ends. Every dollar received goes towards making Game It Forward a reality, so don't hesitate to keep contributing even though our goal is far off!**

Mission
We spend 3 billion hours a week playing games worldwide. If those games donated just one penny an hour, we'd raise $30 million a week for people in need. Game It Forward will help make that happen by producing free-to-play games where money generated from ads and in-game purchases is donated to charities. Support Game It Forward in changing the world through the power of play!

Background
I started Game It Forward to make games that will change the world. I love games. I love playing and working on them, and I know they have the power to be more than entertainment. I was inspired by designers like Jane McGonigal, Ian Bogost, and Brenda Brathwaite who are already changing the world with games. I thought, “What if I could pair the most talented game designers with people passionately working for social change?” The games that would come out of this collaboration could be world-changing. That was the thought that prompted me to leave the for-profit side of the industry and create Game It Forward.

How It Works
Someone plays one of Game It Forward’s games. That person has an awesome time. They watch ads and, if they like, buy power-ups and other in-game items. The money generated from those ads and purchases is split between Game It Forward and the charity of the player’s choice. It’s that simple: Game It Forward converts play into charitable donations!

The Charities
Our first charity partner is Seattle Children’s, a compassionate community where skilled physicians, researchers, nurses, and staff partner with patients and families to help every child live their best life. We’re looking to add six more charity partners, one in each of the following areas: Environmental Protection, Animal Welfare, Microfinance, Human Rights, and Clean Water. With this breadth of charities, Game It Forward hopes to provide at least one cause that each of our players is passionate about supporting.

Our First Game
Game It Forward has partnered with WXP Games to produce our first game: Tringo. Tringo is an approachable casual game that combines light-hearted trivia with the excitement of bingo. Players take the roles of celebrity game-show contestants. The higher they score, the more money goes to the charity of their choice. Tringo is free to play; the money donated to the charities comes from revenue generated via ads and micro-transactions.

Tringo players can also compete against their friends to see who is doing the most good. Every question in Tringo has several correct answers. Some are easy to figure out, and others are more challenging, allowing all levels of players to succeed!

At the end of each game players see how well they’ve done, how they stack up compared to their friends, and, most importantly, how much they’ve contributed to their charity.

The Summit
Tringo was designed at the Game It Forward Summit by a ground-breaking collaboration between passionate social-change agents (from the nonprofits PATH and Seattle Children’s) and talented game designers (working at Valve, Zynga, PopCap Games, Big Fish Games, Amazon Game Studio, and Hasbro’s Wizards of the Coast)!

Where Your Money Goes
We need to raise $125,000 to produce the basic version of Tringo. About half of that funding will go to engineering Tringo, taking the design and turning it into an exciting, playable game. The next quarter of the funding will support the business side of Game It Forward, hiring a person to work with sponsors and charity partners, and oversee the administrative and operational work required to keep a nonprofit organization running. The final quarter will pay the fees and taxes associated with running this Indiegogo campaign.

Your contribution will help make Tringo a reality, lay the foundation for Game It Forward and our charity partners to thrive, and most importantly, help us change the world - one game at a time. Thank you for your support!

story:
Background:

Hey everyone, my name is Carl Bledsoe. I am currently working for a small LAN Center in Illinois and I enjoy my job. I love working with video games, working with gamers, and playing video games. When I was 13, I built a LAN Center building (it also had a movie theater) out of Legos and then that is when I know I wanted to own my own LAN Center (and maybe a movie theater). At the age of 18, I put together a business plan with my friends  for Frag Head Gaming. I was on my way...
 
Growing up where there was no extra money, building capital for a business start up was impossible. I had no savings or credit. My only real option was to find an investor... and that didn't go so well. By age 20, I gave up on my quest to open a LAN Center.
 
Now, 2 years later I came up with a way to satisfy my need to own a video game related business. It's called Fragged Ya Gaming, and it could be the next greatest thing for the LAN Center industry.
 
Fragged Ya Gaming will be a service that will connect gamers to LAN Centers, LAN Centers to LAN Centers and LAN Centers to events.

What we do:

We will host large video gaming events, these events will be exclusive to LAN Centers and their gamers. We will also allow LAN Centers to host their own events that other LAN Centers can attend. We will also help find sponsors as well as sponsor events hosted by LAN Centers. Events include; Tournaments, Leagues, and Showdowns.
 
We will also promote each LAN Center that signs up. Each LAN Center will have its own profile with every team that plays for them. We will also have a Zip Code search so gamers can find their  closest LAN Center.

Why:

Its time for a change... LAN Centers have been doing the same thing for years. It's time to connect everyone together. It's time to have more fun doing what we all love.
 
You might be asking why would we need Fragged Ya Gaming if there is online play... Simple. Everyone plays online, this includes; hackers, cheaters, and people that are just not fun. Fragged Ya Gaming will be played through LAN Centers. We can filter out the hackers, cheaters and hold the LAN Center responsible for their gamers.
 
If a LAN Center or gamer cheats, we can simple ban them. Making the issue go away.
 

How will the money be used:

All funding will be used on our website project. This is a huge project, and I invested everything I had into it thus far.

Other ways you can help:

Spread the word!

Thanks for taking the time to read my campaign!

story:
My name is Colton Phillips. I am a game designer, and software engineering student at the University of Victoria. I helped found UVic GameDev which meets once a week to discuss important topics on game development and MAKE GAMES! 

In order for me to make the Indie games that I want to make I need a Game Maker: Studio Master license. This costs $500. That's a lot of apples and chips. But it's actually really cool! You see Game Maker is a lot of fun to use, and it can target to almost any platform you can name! I can make web games. I can make mobile games! PC. Apple. HTML5. No prob!

http://www.yoyogames.com/gamemaker/studio/master

With a copy of Game Maker Studio I'll be able to port the many Game Maker games UVic GameDev has collectively created to our website for everyone to play, and to include in the UVic GameDev Bundle! 

I'll also be able to more effectively teach game development. Game Maker studio provides web playability providing a feedback loop for us gamedevs. Feedback loops are a BIG DEAL!

My goal is to reach $555 with your support. If I can come close to that goal, I'm sure I can afford to pay the remaining balance. I simply cannot afford to make games without your support. Any and all charity is greatly appreciated.

UVic GameDev:
http://www.facebook.com/groups/uvicgamedev/
http://www.twitter.com/UVicGameDev

story:
Travel to ancient lands and take part in the action and excitement of Abraham's life. Fierce battles, honor and glory, and the destruction of ancient evils await you on your path as you choose how your own story will play out.

We hold the Bible completely sacred, and we’ve gone to great lengths to maintain authenticity. For this reason, we formed an advisory team of four pastors and ministry leaders who work with us for the purpose of accurately portraying this amazing story, especially the more controversial aspects of it.  

Bible Chronicles: The Call of Abraham is the first Christian video game of its kind: the top-notch graphics are visually-stimulating and the action-packed storylines will keep players engaged. Genesis is full of familiar stories, but they’ve never been told from this perspective. We start out just before Abraham leaves Haran, and because the main character is someone joining Abraham’s caravan, you’re right in the thick of the action.

Hundreds of characters,  ancient cities, and hours of engaging sub-plots await in the immersive game world of “The Call of Abraham.” Players will not only be entertained as they build their character and face intriguing challenges, they will also have the opportunity to enrich their knowledge of the history and cultures surrounding Abraham’s famous journey.

  • Bible Chronicles: The Call of Abraham is a single player, third person role playing video game which follows the story of Abraham in the Bible. The player takes on the role of a fictional Elamite outcast who is hired onto Abraham's caravan before departing Haran.   This character was formerly a soldier of Elam and has skills that are very important for a perilous journey into unknown lands.
  • Controlling your character and the GUI elements are similar to some of popular MMORPGs like World of Warcraft or Lords of the Ring Online.  
  • In the time of Abraham, much of Canaan had fallen under the controlling of the rising power of Elam to the east. As the player character is an Elamite outcast, this could present complications for the player throughout the game.  

  • Players will adventure in an open world spanning from Egypt to the eastern parts of Mesopotamia, completing tasks to help Abraham on his journey such as scouting new areas, defending the caravan, trading, and more.
  • Numerous subplots bring depth and flesh out the historical and cultural context of the story, including the background story of the player character himself. 
  • We believe that the terrain is one of the largest ever made for an adventure video game.  It would take many days of non-stop exploration to view it entirely if that was all that you did.  

  • In the Battle of Siddim, Chedorlaomer the King of Elam allied with three other kings to wage battle against five cities of southeastern Canaan. These events bring about an important revelation about the player character's own story.  

We’ve spent years researching and planning all of the details – such as which historical Pharaoh we should build our character on (in the end, we decided Senusret I made the most sense) – and we have many of our cast of characters fully developed and almost entirely animated.

Our primary focus moving forward is the cinematic work, the completion of the many ancient cities in the game, wrapping up the numerous sub-plots which populate the game world, and then bringing it all together. 

Phoenix Interactive Studios is located in Bakersfield, California and is led by its two co-founders Martin Bertram and Richard Gaeta.For the last ten years they have owned and operated a successful technology consulting and software development firm called I.T. Works which specializes in custom business software.

Prior to this, Richard worked for several Fortune 500 companies at various levels of management while Martin worked as a computer game designer on numerous projects going back to 1991 with several popular MUDs which were the precursor to today’s MMORPGs.  He also authored a medieval fiction novel, published in 2006, titled Vanity of Vanities.

We are also blessed to have a great production team of 3D modelers, artists, and hard core game enthusiasts working for us as well, who are equally if not more excited to see the finished product. Our team members include James, Ryan, Mark, Travis, Chuck, Kunal, Jeffrey, Liuda, Saim, and Anakin (not Skywalker).

Our Bible Advisory Team

We have known most of our advisors for almost a decade, and we appreciate all of the time they take to to ensure our storylines and characters are true Biblical representations. Although we consider ourselves devoted Christians, it’s amazing how many details this team has caught and adjusted to make sure we stay accurate to the biblical record.

Travel to ancient lands and take part in the action and excitement of Abraham's life. Fierce battles, honor and glory, and the destruction of ancient evils await you on your path as you choose how your own story will play out.We hold the Bible completely sacred, and we’ve gone to great lengths to maintain authenticity. For this reason, we formed an advisory team of four pastors and ministry leaders who work with us for the purpose of accurately portraying this amazing story, especially the more controversial aspects of it.  Bible Chronicles: The Call of Abraham is the first Christian video game of its kind: the top-notch graphics are visually-stimulating and the action-packed storylines will keep players engaged. Genesis is full of familiar stories, but they’ve never been told from this perspective. We start out just before Abraham leaves Haran, and because the main character is someone joining Abraham’s caravan, you’re right in the thick of the action.Hundreds of characters,  ancient cities, and hours of engaging sub-plots await in the immersive game world of “The Call of Abraham.” Players will not only be entertained as they build their character and face intriguing challenges, they will also have the opportunity to enrich their knowledge of the history and cultures surrounding Abraham’s famous journey.
Bible Chronicles: The Call of Abraham is a single player, third person role playing video game which follows the story of Abraham in the Bible. The player takes on the role of a fictional Elamite outcast who is hired onto Abraham's caravan before departing Haran.   This character was formerly a soldier of Elam and has skills that are very important for a perilous journey into unknown lands.
Controlling your character and the GUI elements are similar to some of popular MMORPGs like World of Warcraft or Lords of the Ring Online.  
In the time of Abraham, much of Canaan had fallen under the controlling of the rising power of Elam to the east. As the player character is an Elamite outcast, this could present complications for the player throughout the game.  

Players will adventure in an open world spanning from Egypt to the eastern parts of Mesopotamia, completing tasks to help Abraham on his journey such as scouting new areas, defending the caravan, trading, and more.
Numerous subplots bring depth and flesh out the historical and cultural context of the story, including the background story of the player character himself. 
We believe that the terrain is one of the largest ever made for an adventure video game.  It would take many days of non-stop exploration to view it entirely if that was all that you did.  
In the Battle of Siddim, Chedorlaomer the King of Elam allied with three other kings to wage battle against five cities of southeastern Canaan. These events bring about an important revelation about the player character's own story.  We’ve spent years researching and planning all of the details – such as which historical Pharaoh we should build our character on (in the end, we decided Senusret I made the most sense) – and we have many of our cast of characters fully developed and almost entirely animated.Our primary focus moving forward is the cinematic work, the completion of the many ancient cities in the game, wrapping up the numerous sub-plots which populate the game world, and then bringing it all together. Phoenix Interactive Studios is located in Bakersfield, California and is led by its two co-founders Martin Bertram and Richard Gaeta.For the last ten years they have owned and operated a successful technology consulting and software development firm called I.T. Works which specializes in custom business software.Prior to this, Richard worked for several Fortune 500 companies at various levels of management while Martin worked as a computer game designer on numerous projects going back to 1991 with several popular MUDs which were the precursor to today’s MMORPGs.  He also authored a medieval fiction novel, published in 2006, titled Vanity of Vanities.We are also blessed to have a great production team of 3D modelers, artists, and hard core game enthusiasts working for us as well, who are equally if not more excited to see the finished product. Our team members include James, Ryan, Mark, Travis, Chuck, Kunal, Jeffrey, Liuda, Saim, and Anakin (not Skywalker).Our Bible Advisory TeamWe have known most of our advisors for almost a decade, and we appreciate all of the time they take to to ensure our storylines and characters are true Biblical representations. Although we consider ourselves devoted Christians, it’s amazing how many details this team has caught and adjusted to make sure we stay accurate to the biblical record.

story:
The Plot of Legend of Animana

 

The land of Animana is a calm, yet peaceful land. Things were always about talking problems through and solving them quickly. Not all things are what it seems, though! An evil wizard by the name of Nagaim decided to use his evil wizard powers to curse the land! By doing this, he made it to where the land had went to war and learned what it was like. Every single person is now possessed! The main characters are "immune" to this curse, as they were visiting another land which was exactly no different than their own. Their own parents, friends, and family are now alive and aggressive. How will the three of them work together to battle the evil wizard Nagaim?!

 

About Me

Hi, I'm Anna!

Some of you may know me as Gasai Yuno or Anna. Ever since my dream of becoming an English major fell through, I spend most of my time studying game design and writing via watching youtube and Google searching.

As some of you may know  I wish to make an RPG Maker Game inspired by various anime and manga series. 

What We Need & What You Get

 We need money from kind old folks like you! Making a game in RPG Maker and hiring game writers, devs, graphic artists, and such can be expensive without donations. All money will go into the game and paying our own staff once their work is completed. 

You'll get a free digital DOWNLOAD if this game if you donate $10 or more toward our project today. :) Also, a special THANK YOU in the game credits at the end of the game. 

 

The Impact

Here's what I can confirm thus far.

 - Will be anime inspired graphically (graphics similar to stuff like chrono trigger and such)

 - Will use original characters, an original plot, and more - It'll be turn-based combat like in FF3-6' style

 - Classes such as mage, warrior, and rouge maybe added.. Or I may make a twist and not have any classes period. 

 I'll be making a dev blog and possible Facebook page for this game too! Blog is more of a happening as I cannot run more than my own and two friends pages without going insane..

But anyway, if you have suggestions, questions, and the like you're free to post them here. I may even try and find some writers to help with the story, script, and whatever else.

The cost and why I did it at this much is because game artists, writers, and such are high in price and we need a hosting solution that has our game downloads on many mirror sites.  We may, if allowed, use some of these funds to get web hosting to last us for a year or more. 

Risks and challenges

If I cannot raise the funds to make the game come true, then I will try and do this project solo and with a few friends. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, you're free to contribute via our soon to be set up online forum and my Facebook page. Post all suggestions, questions, and anyting via the message system on the page or contact me on Skype at gasai.yunochan. 

 

 

FAQ

 

Q: When will the official forums be up? When will we see an actual Facebook page for it?

A: The website and forum will be up within the next few weeks or two. A Facebook page will be made very soon when we actually start work. 

 

Q: Why no screenshots?

A: The game hasn't been made yet. We will post a buttload of screenshots as we make the game. You're still welcome to donate!

 

Q: Why no video of the game?

A: Read above

 

Q: Why should I donate to you? 

A: I have a team of people who will help me design the game via RPG Maker VX Ace. I have experience dealing with, and handling the general public. We are all avid fans of old school RPGs like Final Fantasy, Chrono Trigger, and many others.

story:
Link to the greenlight page: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=176185396

Stretch goal Nº1 -  $15.000 (ACHIEVED)

 

Coop mode: You will be able to play with your friends as help anytime on your castle!
 

Clock and date: The game will use your system's clock to change the enviroment (day/night) and special events will be displayed.

 

Stretch goal Nº2 -  $20.000

                 

               

Refinement: More detailed graphic and animations for all characters and enemies. More complex bossfights. More fighting styles (better bows system, two weapons at once, war hammer) and more magic skills. More items and more scenarios ambientations.

Multilanguage: The game will be available in as many languages as we can.

Challenge mode: Enjoy awesome challenges, see how far you can go in a series of huge fights and boss fights. Challenge your friends on vs mode.

Explore a unique RPG/metroidvania adventure based on the content of your computer.

 

AdventureOS is an 2.5D RPG/Metroidvania adventure based game that is entirely auto-generated by the content (folders and files) of your computer. Each room, object, enemy, puzzle, key, treasure, boss... Is actually an interpretation of the files you can find on the computer where the game is running, making each adventure as exciting as exclusive for each user.

                                (Click here to see the prototype screenshots)

.....

                            (Click here to see the prototype screenshots)


he architect has a problem.
Together with his castle, all the creatures who live in it are in danger. A big crisis is to be faced. Regardless the safety measures taken to protect his castle, the fateful day has come.
There is an unwished visitor among his guests, hidden behind a harmless appearance. This despicable intruder has casted a curse in order to achieve his goal: To take over the architect's wealth and dominate all his inhabitants.
A caravan of voluntaries has now settled into his castle, leaded by their heroic captain who is determined to free them from the curse.
Will he be able to overcome the challenges the evil intruder develops?
Like in all epic stories, the greatest roles are played from behind the scenes.


As you may know all computers have a directory of folders where all the system files are organized pretty much like this:
                                   
AdventureOS takes your folders and the files inside them, to generate a huge castle where the folders become the rooms, staying connected to each other as usual, and the files become the NPCs, decoration, items, enemies etc, depending on their format. Yes, it can be a little difficult to imagine such an innovative concept before actually playing it. Here you have some illustrative examples: In this example folder you have two .txt files and other two folders. Depending on the name of the current folder you are in, its weight, the number of subfolders inside, and the type of files, all the environment changes generating a unique kind of room in the castle.


In this particular one the “.txt” turns into a pacific NPC. As mentioned before each extension of the files turns into something different. The other two folders become doors which direct the player to another room generated by this same process when entered.


In this particular folder we have “.txt”, “.xls” and “.zip” files. Just as before, its content creates a certain environment and again the different files inside of it turn into different objects.
We have another pacific NPC from a “.txt”, we have snakes from the “.xls” files and a treasure from the “.zip” files. There are no more folders so no doors are created.


Note that in certain cases (depending on the amount of files with the same extension inside a folder) a few files can merge creating an upgraded version of an item or NPC. "In" the example, the big treasure is made out of three “.zip” files and a big snake is created out of three “.xls” files.
All the platforms and puzzles are created according to the needs of each room and according to the difficulty needed for this section of the castle.


For better understanding we will explain the game's mechanics, such as difficulty, objectives etc in the next section!


The castle is divided in segments, representedos by the depth of the folder in relation to the others. The closest folders to the hard drive will be at level 1. Every new folder inside a previous one will be found at the next level from it.

                                     

To access upper levels you will need to learn special abilities such as double jumps, wall breaking, speed boost, super size and so on.

The game works like a complex Metroidvania where getting to new levels requires exploring previous rooms, fighting enemies and solving puzzles to keep going. Your main goal is to clean all the castle's rooms from the curse casted by the Intruder. To clean a room you must set all the NPCs free by killing the creatures that keep those NPCs inside them. Once you clean a room you don't have to clean it again. But watch out! if you miss one enemy you will have to start over the next time you visit it. 


The skills must be acquired by earning experience inside previous levels. Every explored room gives a little more experience to the character, which will be invested on unlocking the required skills from a skill tree.

Fallen enemies will drop random items depending on the folder level, size, power and drop rate.
Items such as hoods, swords, books or shields will increase the character's stats and add element modifyers.

                                            
These elements are Liquid, Plasma, Mineral, Steam, Life, "Psique", Natural, Combat (similar to the ones in the videogame "Pokèmon", which interact exactly the same way with their resistances and weaknesses)


 

Each folder generally counts on a predominant amount of a certain  kind of files, for instance, folders containing music or pictures.

The  type of file, its weight and its name will define the general  environment of the folder as well as its size and the different puzzles  or platforms to be solved in order to access the different areas of the  room.

This way we will find countless possibilities regarding  sizes, distances and platforms depending on the requirements of each  level.

It will be possible to find a long corridor with doors  linking us to new rooms, as well as rooms containing a single small  space where to find a special object for your character or maybe a  reward.

It might be a big hall full of enemies along the different obstacles and platforms, and also a huge room where to fight enemies or even bosses. 

There will be as many possibilities as users, and more! Each computer allows a different new world to be created!

With each unlocked and clear room the general map will be updated in the inventory of your character.  You will be able to spot all visited rooms, all locations of relevant objects and obstacles where special abilities are required. It will be your guide through your huge castle made out of links and folders.

Expect infinite possibilities from this innovative game! Along with the Indiegogo updates deeper explanations will be given.

Feel free to ask any questions you can't find at our FAQ section!


 - Which platforms will be AdventurOS released on?

        AdventurOS will be released for Windows, Mac and Linux.

- How does the game analyze my computer? Is it safe?

        The game will only index a folder when entered, and it only reads the information while being inside it. The game is not going to change any file except the ones inside the game folder.

- How will the funding be spent?

        Since there are three of us in the team making the game (living in different countries) , after taking around 25% for taxes once the campaign gets funded, the rest will be used to pay rent, utilities and equipment such as software and hardware for the development of the game. If we get any extra funding we will add stretch goals to the campaign with more features since we will be able to extend the development process then.

- How and when do I get my perks?

       How: Right after the campaign ends we'll contact all the backers to thank them for their contribution and we will explain any particular case on how to get their perks. When: Usually, and depending on the type of perk, all of them will be delivered in the first and second month from the end of the campaign. This always in the case the project gets successfully funded.

-What happens when some changes are made to the programs, files or directories of my computer?

        The game will index the folder when entered. When some change has been made (only rooms that has been already visited) the player gets a message, something like "The castle has trembled, it seems like the Architect has made some changes" then you can visit those rooms again to update the map and clean the new area if needed.

            

(Please feel free to ask any question in the commentaries, We'll add the most common ones to this list with an answer as soon as we get your feedback)

André Marí Coppola: He takes care of the project's audiovisual aspects and general game design. Characters, graphics (environment, scenarios, etc...), music and sounds. He also gives advice on how to refine details to help improve aspects of the gameplay and visual experience.

Emilio Coppola:  He is the hermit who spends many hours at a time as needed to make every speck of dust move as it should be. That is, the programmer. Game developer by day and open-source programmer by night.

Lorena Casanova a.k.a @MissScripter: This devoted indie is responsible for the code of Super Tower Rush, with André as an artist as mentioned before.
She was introduced to programming while she collaborated with the Evelend brothers as a proofreader for Pixelry.
Not long after that she was encouraged to materialize her first solo release, which brought Antipodes to life, the first in what is becoming a long list of development achievements.

 

Other games made by André, Emilio or/and Lorena:

Super Tower Rush

Pixelry

Antipodes

Pixelry: A Day At The Races (mini game)

story:
Short Summary

Longcat 3D is a game made to immerse the player in a world of memes and madness. 

Longcat will fight off his evil adversaries throughout the game and defeat the evil Tacgnol's army! 

soon www.longcatgame.com will be updated with the new Long cat 3D away from the old long cat alpha version built 2 years ago in the summer after my first year at university. The original long cat game just so you know... works well on only selected android devices.... where as Long cat 3D will be completely cross platform!

It is aimed be released on the iOS Market, Android Market and as a web application by Mid May. 

The wish for the game to encapsulate all sorts of users cartoon art and memes where I can and I encourage incorporating fantastic digital music from various artists who promote the free and open use of their music. 

The game is to be used to encapsulate the feelings that memes create, the happiness and joy that the open internet provides for the hundreds and thousands of us who love looking at pictures of cute cats and motivators. 

The video shows the current state of the game and you can subscribe to the development log at: 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/LONG-CAT-the-GAME/236916466375581?ref=hl

What We Need 

I need $6000 for all the software I would prefer to have to build the game.

 

Although the game can be made without the software it will not have the entirely unique look I am wanting from the game.

A can email you a more detailed break down of EXACTLY what that $6000 is made of if you are a technical and are wondering what software I want to use. 

 

What You Get

 

All details are in the perks. just by donating I will add you to the mailing list... Or you can like the facebook page here: 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/LONG-CAT-the-GAME...

The original long cat game just so you know... works well on only selected android devices.... where as Long cat 3D will be completely cross platform!
It is aimed be released on the iOS Market, Android Market and as a web application by Mid May. 
The wish for the game to encapsulate all sorts of users cartoon art and memes where I can and I encourage incorporating fantastic digital music from various artists who promote the free and open use of their music. 
The game is to be used to encapsulate the feelings that memes create, the happiness and joy that the open internet provides for the hundreds and thousands of us who love looking at pictures of cute cats and motivators. 
The video shows the current state of the game and you can subscribe to the development log at: 
http://www.facebook.com/pages/LONG-CAT-the-GAME/236916466375581?ref=hl


What We Need 
I need $6000 for all the software I would prefer to have to build the game.
 
Although the game can be made without the software it will not have the entirely unique look I am wanting from the game.
A can email you a more detailed break down of EXACTLY what that $6000 is made of if you are a technical and are wondering what software I want to use. 
 
What You Get
 
All details are in the perks. just by donating I will add you to the mailing list... Or you can like the facebook page here: 
http://www.facebook.com/pages/LONG-CAT-the-GAME...

story:
Dromor is a free fantasy RPG game for multiple platforms starting on iOS, Android and others. Choose your character between 5 unique races – Orc, Demon, Elf, Paladin and Sorcerer. Complete quests, collect gold and diamonds, upgrade your skills and spells, equip weapons and armor, fight other players and monsters and challenge your opponents to the throne of Dromor! 

 


- more than 75 quests + constant updates

- more than 60 weapons and equipment + more to come

- gorgeous graphics

- an epic story

- 50 + game challenges

- 5 unique character classes

- 5 skills - attack, defence, agility, health and mana

- unique spells for every character class

- great power-ups

- magical potions

- powerful runes

- a fee game with free updates

- many more to come

 

 

We are a small indie studio of 9 people, called SunTouch Ltd, dedicated to developing great games and apps for the world. Our first game has been an idea for about 4 years and just a few months ago we managed to raise some cash (about 15 000 dollars) to start developing our dream project – a free multi-platform RPG. We called it Dromor. Our friends at TenTouch Ltd help us with the software development of the game.

 


As mentioned, Dromor is our first main project.  Before that, we worked as employees and freelancers on different projects and some of us are actually still working at their 9 to 5 jobs to cover their expenses and raise some more money for the game. The guys at TenTouch who help us with the development of Dromor, have some great apps and games done already. You can check them out here: http://www.tentouchapps.com/apps

 

 

The main reason you would want to support this project would be because it aims to bring these types of RPGs to the next level. How is this achieved - through changing and enhancing the gameplay itself. The main new things this game has to offer, different from all other games, are the following:

- Five unique characters. Every character is unique with its spells, strategies and development. In other games, you chose a character or even customize it, but after that, the game is not much different than what it would have been if you chose another character. In Dromor every character has its own path of development.

- Fight moves. Decide what moves and spells you are going to use in battle to defeat your opponent. In most other games the computer decides what you do in battle and its outcome. If the other player has more stuff than you, they win. In Dromor it all depends on you. You choose what skill or spell to enhance and use in battle. See how the battle goes and how to do even better next time. Even if your opponent has better equipment, you can defeat them using your skills and strategies.

- Great storyline. Because of the PvP game model, most games of this kind do not focus on the storyline and many of them do not have any story at all. We think the storyline is as important as the game itself, and it is an essential part of the game. This is why we have written an extensive story. As you progress through the game, you will uncover the complete story and then... write it yourself.

- Diverse quests. Choose how to complete a quest and what steps to take to reach the goal. Help those in need, defend your kingdom, join sides in battles and slay enemies to take their treasures.

- Giving back to the players. Last, but not least, with Dromor we have one main objective:

To create a great gaming experience and balance for all players in the game, regardless of how much money (or none at all) they spend. Therefore, not only are we determined to make the gameplay and graphics great, but we also made an amazing reward system that will constantly give you ‘diamonds’ (real-money in-game currency) as you play the game and reward you for any goal or level you reach. So the more you play the more ‘diamonds’ you receive and you don’t have to spend real money to be competitive. You can play totally for free. On top of that, if you like the game and invite your friends in, we will also give you ‘diamonds’ for free to show our gratitude.

 

 


  • Full game story and script
  • Great artwork and design
  • Five great characters – Orc, Demon, Paladin, Elf, Sorcerer; Each with their own spells and skills
  • Items such as: weapons, armor, staves, runes, potions
  • Five buildings – The Blacksmith, The Alchemist, The Fountain of Life, The Temple of the Goddess and  The Altar

 

  • Game design upgrades
  • Additional game development
  • Customer support system
  • Game website / forum / features

 

 

  • Animation of fights, spells and others
  • Guild system development
  • Tavern where players can communicate and share
  • More quests
  • More weapons
  • More sounds
  • Epic fights with monsters
  • Multi-platform development
  • Further character development with epic gear and customization
  • Lands – areas with mobs for special quests

 




We don’t really know… of course we will do our best to fund the project as long as possible, but we would definitely not be able to complete the game without outside funding. We may be able to still release the game, but it will not be anything close to what we want it to be and it will not have all the great new features mentioned above. This is why we need your support.


Thank you for your time and attention!

The SunTouch Team

story:
*UPDATE* - July 26, 2014

We've finally launched! After 6 months of development we are proud to release Furball Rampage!

Right now, only the Android version is available, but fear not, the iOS version will be out shortly in 2 weeks!

Meanwhile, for all your supporters, we are in the process of putting all the perks and gifts in production. It should be available shortly and should be able to ship in August! But for now, please enjoy the game that you guys help to make it a reality!

Once again, everyone here at Twitchy Finger would like to thank all of you supporters for all the help and contributions! We couldn't of done it without you guys and it has been a tremendous honor!

*UPDATE* - JULY 24, 2014

IT'S COMING...


*Update* - July 11, 2014

It's been awhile since we've updated our status for Furball Rampage. Not to keep you out of the loop so here's a quick Friday update. The last two weeks we've been beta testing the game, fixing bugs and balancing the gameplay. We're also adding some additional things that we see fit that can enhance the experience. The game is fully functional now. We hope to get the game out within 2 weeks time for the Android, with the iOS version shortly after that. For those that supported us through Indiegogo, the digital perks will be sent out shortly after the game launches. For those that have physical perks, we are in the process of getting them made and ready. They should be ready to ship in Aug and get to you by then! We're all excited about this and hope you'll be too!


*Update* - June 23, 2014

Thank-you everyone for supporting our campaign. It's been a tremendously rewarding experience for us. We can't thank everyone enough. We've received a lot of positive feedback during this campaign. 

As promised, we will release this game within 60 days from now. We couldn't of done this without all your support. We will have the game ready shortly and send out your selected perks within this time frame as well! Those of you with physical perks should receive your perks around August. Those with digital perks will receive it via email.

Once again, we at Twitchy Finger Games would like to thank everyone! We will keep updating this campaign up to the day of release! 


*Update* - June 19, 2014

We're winding down with 4 days left. Everyone has been pulling overtime to get this game out as soon as possible. As we promised, this game will release within 60 days after the end of this campaign, so we're all working ultra hard. 

Here's a screenshot of us working on the game's soundtrack and sound effects. 

Again, please keep supporting us and let's finish this campaign with style! 


Thank-you everyone for the support! We're at 48% funded right now. We are tremendously grateful for all the help. We've got exactly 1 week left in our campaign. So please help us spread the word out and hopefully end this week off with a bang! 

Our game is coming along nicely and we're finishing up the UI this week as we speak. We've also started to implement sound effects and music into the game. As we promised, we will release this game within 60 days after this campaign is complete. However, we still got some work to do before then. So please continue to support us! 



*Update* - June 10, 2014

Here we are animating the Kata-Mode characters using Spine software. Our artist first sketches the characters out on Adobe Illustrator, then he separates each characters into parts. Each part is then imported into Spine, reassembled and animated. Once that is done, we export it to Unity 3D which is then integrated into the game. Pretty cool. Check out the animation video below. 


*Update* - June 6, 2014

Getting ready for the weekends again? Here's an update on our progress. We're working on the Kata-Mode of our other characters and have begun animating them. Below is one of the first shots of our Kata-Chip, the aviator goggle wearing friend of Joe. What do you guys think?

Also, recently we've got our first press coverage from Cliqist, a preview of our game. If you want to read it, you can find it on the link below:

Cliqist Preview of Furball Rampage

Next week, we'll have some actual gameplay vids and some behind the scenes videos for you. So stay tuned. Meanwhile, enjoy the weekend everyone!


*UPDATE* - June 3, 2014

We've approached June. Time flies when you're developing a game! We are finalizing some of our other sidekick characters. At the same time, we're starting on the UI as well as localization for our game. So for those of you who like to play in their native language, we've got you covered! 

The UI isn't done yet, so we can't show you just yet! But, we've got 2 more sidekicks ready for you to see. Again, please tell us what you think and even suggests some names for our sidekicks!  We'll be updating you again near the end of the week! 


*Update* - May 30, 2014

Hey guys, A quick update before weekend. So I'm sure you've seen the top two sidekicks already from our past updates. Here's 2 more new ones for you to check out. As for the names, we're still thinking what to call them. If you got a cool name that suits our sidekicks, let us know in the comment section! 


*Update* - May 23, 2014

Happy Friday everyone! Here's an update. We've added new characters to our game! Here's some of them for you to look at. Tell us what you think and which one you like. Each of them will have their own unique abilities! 


*Update* - May 20, 2014

Godzilla recently came out. So we made a fun spoof poster. Just like Godzilla Kata-Joe can wreck havoc and mayhem too! 


*Update* - May 19, 2014

New screenshot of beach level added to Update and Gallery section! 

*Update* - May 17, 2014

We're trending on the 1st page of Indiegogo's Gaming section! Thank-you for all the contributions. We've reached 26% so far. Let's keep it up! 

*Update* - May 16, 2014

It's been an exciting first week! We've managed to raise 25% of our goal! Thank-you everyone who have contributed! Hopefully we can reach our goal! 

*UPDATE* - May 15, 2014

Uploaded a video of the level design artwork from the game. Can view it on the "updates" tab above. As always feel free to comment and give your opinions! We'd love to hear from you! 


*UPDATE* - May 14, 2014

A quick update on what we've been up to these few days. Click on the "updates" tab up top! 

*UPDATE* - May 10, 2014

We updated the campaign video with more info about who we are and what our game is about. Please check out the new video above! 

Furball Rampage is an action side-scrolling running game for iOS & Android. What does a side-scrolling running game have to do with action? Well, unlike most running games out there where you just endlessly jump or duck to avoid obstacles, Furball Rampage adds a unique "twist" to the genre by adding an action element into the game. We call this special element, "Kata-Mode".

Concept art of Joe in various poses

Concept art of Judy and her expressions

Our first inspiration for this mode is from playing Katamari Damacy and it is from this where we got the name "Kata-mode". For those who played this game, you'll know that as the character collects more and more items, the bigger the ball of items get. You start off small but eventually you'll grow to the size of buildings. We took this concept and applied it to our game.

You'll start off with Joe being the size of an average hamster, small and insignificant. As you collect more and more items, you'll be able to transform yourself from a small hamster to a giant monster capable of destroying buildings and wrecking havoc in the city. 

Kata-Mode Screenshots

The second part of our inspiration is from the old-school arcade game Rampage. When you activate your "Kata-Mode", you'll turn into a giant monster and have the ability to smash and destroy buildings around you like in Rampage. As the buildings crumbles, you can grab the people that run out from the buildings and eat them. The more people you eat, the more gold you'll "crap out". As you progress through this mode, you'll battle army soldiers, helicopters, jets and even unlock special collectibles such as celebrities and sports figures for you to eat when they flee from buildings. 

    

Besides "Kata-Mode" we also have bonus stages and alternative paths you can take that breaks free from the usual one-path unchangeable format of the running game genre. There are additional missions for those seeking extra challenge and special rewards for completing them. This unique approach makes Furball Rampage easy to learn and pick up for casual gamers, while at the same time giving it a strategic element for those that want to go beyond casual gaming. 

Concept art of Kata-Mode Joe

 9 Challenging levels littered with obstacles and hazards to test your skill!

 "Kata-Mode" brings unique action element to running game genre!

 Over 30 special missions with unique rewards!

 Over 50 different characters and sidekicks with special abilities!

Tons of hidden collectibles for you to discover!

Sidekicks: 2 of many sidekicks you'll get to pair with your main character

We at Twitchy Finger Ltd. is a startup based in Hong Kong. We're comprised of a tight-knit group of 5 people.  All of us came together from various fields to start a gaming company with the goal of creating games we find fun and enjoyable. Let us introduce you to our team:

Howiejai: Our Game Producer and Co-Founder. He's been in the mobile games business for over 8 years with over 40 different games under his belt. He's our head honcho at Twitchy Finger.

El Rey: Youngest member of our team and our in-house developer. Expert with Unity and specialization in UI. He's our go-to guy for programming.

J.Lo: A veteran artist of over 10 years in art design. Earned his chops in full-length animated films such as Astro Boy and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. 

Hiryu: Started out as an accountant for big international auditing firm, but quit his job to pursue design. Now he's one of our co-founders as well as the guy who makes sure our budget and your funding is wisely spent. 

Hippocrite: Our music guy. Spent the last 10 years as a producer in the music biz. He's also one of our co-founders at Twitchy Finger in charge of all the music and sound designs for our game. 

Early character concepts of Joe

We've also teamed up with local music production Manna Sounds Studio, to create our soundtrack and SFX for Furball Rampage. Manna Sounds Studio is one of the newest state-of-the-art studios in Hong Kong that specializing in music production for international record labels, commercial jingles, radio, television and film. We are very lucky and honored to be collaborating with them on this project. 

     

Manna Sounds Studio

Soundtrack Samples from Furball Rampage

Furball Rampage Soundtrack Theme 1

Furball Rampage Soundtrack Theme 2


We started Twitchy Finger Games as a group of people with a shared vision. We want to make games that at its core are fun and enjoyable for those who play it. Right now we have a playable version of the game running. That being said, there's still a lot of work for us to make the game even better and more polished. This is where we need your help!

    

We know a lot of games that gone through Crowdfunding often don't get made or take a substantial amount of time before it gets released. We believe that if you guys are willing to fund us, we want to get the game out as soon as possible while at the same time meet the quality standards we've set for ourselves. That's why we kept the production time tight and make sure we have realistic attainable goals. 

We are looking to release the game within 60 days at the end of this campaign, so those of you who have supported us won't have to wait long or keep asking us before you see the results! Your funding will go directly towards our last phase of our development process: game balance, bug fixes, testing it on multiple platforms and if possible, as much additional content as possible before launch. We will be grateful with any contributions you can make!

We can't stress enough how much we want to bring this out to everyone as soon as we can. Any questions you have, please feel free to ask us before pledging your donations. We want to make this process as comfortable and as transparent as possible. We know there are lots of games out there looking for funding, so we want let our supporters know exactly what they are funding and where it is going! 

  

AND.... beyond our initial goal, we have other stretch goals that if met, means there's going to be even more cool stuff we can put into the game. The rewards for the stretch goals are even better. Check them out below! 

Here are some our stretch goals we hope to achieve!

What's a crowdfunding campaign without some cool perks? All of our contributors will get our most sincere gratitude with their name listed in the credits (or not for those who prefer anonymous). On top of that, those that give significant contributions will receive some cool goodies specially made as a token of our appreciation! We have a mix of digital and physical perks for different tiers of contributions. I think we've struck a good balance between allocating your funds to our campaign needs while providing you guys with some great gifts. Please check out the perks section for a detailed explanation of the perks available.

$1 or more

Supporter: Thank-you! Every dollar counts! We will put your name on the credit list (or not if you want to be anonymous) and you will receive email with our news, progress and updates! 

$5 or more

Mellow Pack: Your name on credit list and Furball Rampage for iOS/Android plus bonus in-game gold to help you upgrade your character right away!

$10 or more

Normal Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper and digital artwork booklet featuring game and character art.

$15 or more

Annoyed Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, and original digital soundtrack from the game.

$20 or more

Angry Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, and Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage.

Our 4" die-cut stickers

$30 or more

Pissed-Off Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage, and a 16.5” x 23.5” Print of Furball Rampage Title Art.

(Please add $5 USD to shipping)

$40 or more

Furious Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage, a 16.5” x 23.5” Print of Furball Rampage Title Art, and a 36-page A5 art booklet containing concept art, level design art and sketches from the game.

(please add $5 USD to shipping)

$50 or more

Seething Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage, a 16.5” x 23.5” Print of Furball Rampage Title Art, and a 68-page A4 “Making of Furball Rampage” collectors book that includes not only concept art, level design art, and sketches, but also liner notes and insights by our entire team. (This one is really cool! Collectors Item!!)

(Please add $10 USD to shipping)

Furball Rampage: The Collector's Artbook

$100 or more

Rage Pack: Everything from Seething Pack with Print and Collector’s Book signed and individually numbered by everyone here at Twitchy Finger Games. We’ll even throw in the 36-page A5 art booklet from the Furious Pack as well!

(Please add $10 USD to shipping)

$150 or more

Insanity Pack: Everything from Rage Pack + Limited Edition Furball Rampage 2015/16 Calendar and the unlock of our secret character unavailable at release.

(Please add $10 USD to shipping)

$200 or more

Destruction Pack: Everything from Insanity Pack + Furball Rampage T-shirt and a A4 celluloid artwork print.

(Free shipping worldwide!)

$500 or more (limited to 5)

Developers Pack: Everything in Rage Pack plus a custom banner to promote your game in both iOS/Android for first 3 months of release. (Your game must be approved by the app stores of each platform and follow all the app store advertising guidelines)

(Free Shipping Worldwide!)

$1000 or more (limited to 10)

Rampage Pack 1: Everything from Destruction Pack + we will get the Morgan Freeman voice actor used in our game trailer and have him record a short message of your choice just for you! He does a bunch of other celebrity impersonations too and we will give you a list to choose from. You can use it for your voicemail, ringtone or whatever you like!

(Free Shipping Worldwide!)

$1000 or more (limited to 10)

Rampage Pack 2: Everything from Destruction Pack + Your name or name of choice for a Sidekick that we will put into our game! (Name cannot contain profanity or copyrighted brand names and will be approved at the discretion of Twitchy Finger Games)

(Free Shipping Worldwide!)

$3000 or more (limited to 3)

Adopt-a-Hamster Pack: Everything from Destruction Pack + we will go to a local animal shelter and adopt a hamster in need of an owner, get the best cage we can find and fill it with the best quality food and toys we can get our hands on and promise to take care of the hamster for its entire life! We will limit this pledge to only three since we want to ensure the hamsters have enough care they deserve. We will post pictures of our adopted hamster and their pimpin’ habitat and post it on our social media sites and have regular updates of their news! (I’m pretty psyched about this one). 

(Free shipping worldwide: the items, not the hamster!)

Below are some of the hamsters at SPCA waiting to be adopted! We will let you pick which hamster to adopt and give these adorable hamsters the best care possible for rest of their lives! 

SPCA- The Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals. 

$10,000 or more (limited to 1)

Ultimate Pack: Everything from Destruction Pack + we will fly you in from wherever you live to visit us at Twitchy Finger Games in Hong Kong and meet our entire production team! We will include return tickets as well as 3 nights accommodations and a 1-day personalized sightseeing tour of Hong Kong! You get to fund our game AND have a vacation to experience Asia! (All other expenses such as transportation and food will be made by the backer)

Hong Kong: Pearl of the Orient! 

We understand not everyone has the means to monetary contributions. So for those who want to help us out in other ways, here's some things you can do for us: 

Get the Word out on Social Media! 

You guys can help us by Following, Liking, Sharing or Pinning on our social media platforms. The more the better! 

Facebook

Twitter

Pinterest

Instagram: TwitchyFingerGames

Here's some special thanks for those who helped us out during this campaign.

Manna Sounds Studio for their help with our soundtrack & sound effects. 

Jason's Voices for his help on our trailer's voice over. Great Morgan Freeman impression!
