For those that supported us through Indiegogo, the digital perks will be sent out shortly after the game launches. For those that have physical perks, we are in the process of getting them made and ready. They should be ready to ship in Aug and get to you by then! We're all excited about this and hope you'll be too!*Update* - June 23, 2014Thank-you everyone for supporting our campaign. It's been a tremendously rewarding experience for us. We can't thank everyone enough. We've received a lot of positive feedback during this campaign. As promised, we will release this game within 60 days from now. We couldn't of done this without all your support. We will have the game ready shortly and send out your selected perks within this time frame as well! Those of you with physical perks should receive your perks around August. Those with digital perks will receive it via email.Once again, we at Twitchy Finger Games would like to thank everyone! We will keep updating this campaign up to the day of release! *Update* - June 19, 2014We're winding down with 4 days left. Everyone has been pulling overtime to get this game out as soon as possible. As we promised, this game will release within 60 days after the end of this campaign, so we're all working ultra hard. Here's a screenshot of us working on the game's soundtrack and sound effects. Again, please keep supporting us and let's finish this campaign with style! Thank-you everyone for the support! We're at 48% funded right now. We are tremendously grateful for all the help. We've got exactly 1 week left in our campaign. So please help us spread the word out and hopefully end this week off with a bang! Our game is coming along nicely and we're finishing up the UI this week as we speak. We've also started to implement sound effects and music into the game. As we promised, we will release this game within 60 days after this campaign is complete. However, we still got some work to do before then. So please continue to support us! *Update* - June 10, 2014Here we are animating the Kata-Mode characters using Spine software. Our artist first sketches the characters out on Adobe Illustrator, then he separates each characters into parts. Each part is then imported into Spine, reassembled and animated. Once that is done, we export it to Unity 3D which is then integrated into the game. Pretty cool. Check out the animation video below. *Update* - June 6, 2014Getting ready for the weekends again? Here's an update on our progress. We're working on the Kata-Mode of our other characters and have begun animating them. Below is one of the first shots of our Kata-Chip, the aviator goggle wearing friend of Joe. What do you guys think?Also, recently we've got our first press coverage from Cliqist, a preview of our game. If you want to read it, you can find it on the link below:Cliqist Preview of Furball RampageNext week, we'll have some actual gameplay vids and some behind the scenes videos for you. So stay tuned. Meanwhile, enjoy the weekend everyone!*UPDATE* - June 3, 2014We've approached June. Time flies when you're developing a game! We are finalizing some of our other sidekick characters. At the same time, we're starting on the UI as well as localization for our game. So for those of you who like to play in their native language, we've got you covered! The UI isn't done yet, so we can't show you just yet! But, we've got 2 more sidekicks ready for you to see. Again, please tell us what you think and even suggests some names for our sidekicks!  We'll be updating you again near the end of the week! *Update* - May 30, 2014Hey guys, A quick update before weekend. So I'm sure you've seen the top two sidekicks already from our past updates. Here's 2 more new ones for you to check out. As for the names, we're still thinking what to call them. If you got a cool name that suits our sidekicks, let us know in the comment section! *Update* - May 23, 2014Happy Friday everyone! Here's an update. We've added new characters to our game! Here's some of them for you to look at. Tell us what you think and which one you like. Each of them will have their own unique abilities! *Update* - May 20, 2014Godzilla recently came out. So we made a fun spoof poster. Just like Godzilla Kata-Joe can wreck havoc and mayhem too! *Update* - May 19, 2014New screenshot of beach level added to Update and Gallery section! *Update* - May 17, 2014We're trending on the 1st page of Indiegogo's Gaming section! Thank-you for all the contributions. We've reached 26% so far. Let's keep it up! *Update* - May 16, 2014It's been an exciting first week! We've managed to raise 25% of our goal! Thank-you everyone who have contributed! Hopefully we can reach our goal! *UPDATE* - May 15, 2014Uploaded a video of the level design artwork from the game. Can view it on the "updates" tab above. As always feel free to comment and give your opinions! We'd love to hear from you! *UPDATE* - May 14, 2014A quick update on what we've been up to these few days. Click on the "updates" tab up top! *UPDATE* - May 10, 2014We updated the campaign video with more info about who we are and what our game is about. Please check out the new video above! Furball Rampage is an action side-scrolling running game for iOS & Android. What does a side-scrolling running game have to do with action? Well, unlike most running games out there where you just endlessly jump or duck to avoid obstacles, Furball Rampage adds a unique "twist" to the genre by adding an action element into the game. We call this special element, "Kata-Mode".Concept art of Joe in various posesConcept art of Judy and her expressionsOur first inspiration for this mode is from playing Katamari Damacy and it is from this where we got the name "Kata-mode". For those who played this game, you'll know that as the character collects more and more items, the bigger the ball of items get. You start off small but eventually you'll grow to the size of buildings. We took this concept and applied it to our game.You'll start off with Joe being the size of an average hamster, small and insignificant. As you collect more and more items, you'll be able to transform yourself from a small hamster to a giant monster capable of destroying buildings and wrecking havoc in the city. Kata-Mode ScreenshotsThe second part of our inspiration is from the old-school arcade game Rampage. When you activate your "Kata-Mode", you'll turn into a giant monster and have the ability to smash and destroy buildings around you like in Rampage. As the buildings crumbles, you can grab the people that run out from the buildings and eat them. The more people you eat, the more gold you'll "crap out". As you progress through this mode, you'll battle army soldiers, helicopters, jets and even unlock special collectibles such as celebrities and sports figures for you to eat when they flee from buildings.     Besides "Kata-Mode" we also have bonus stages and alternative paths you can take that breaks free from the usual one-path unchangeable format of the running game genre. There are additional missions for those seeking extra challenge and special rewards for completing them. This unique approach makes Furball Rampage easy to learn and pick up for casual gamers, while at the same time giving it a strategic element for those that want to go beyond casual gaming. Concept art of Kata-Mode Joe
 9 Challenging levels littered with obstacles and hazards to test your skill!
 "Kata-Mode" brings unique action element to running game genre!
 Over 30 special missions with unique rewards!
 Over 50 different characters and sidekicks with special abilities!
Tons of hidden collectibles for you to discover!
Sidekicks: 2 of many sidekicks you'll get to pair with your main characterWe at Twitchy Finger Ltd. is a startup based in Hong Kong. We're comprised of a tight-knit group of 5 people.  All of us came together from various fields to start a gaming company with the goal of creating games we find fun and enjoyable. Let us introduce you to our team:Howiejai: Our Game Producer and Co-Founder. He's been in the mobile games business for over 8 years with over 40 different games under his belt. He's our head honcho at Twitchy Finger.El Rey: Youngest member of our team and our in-house developer. Expert with Unity and specialization in UI. He's our go-to guy for programming.J.Lo: A veteran artist of over 10 years in art design. Earned his chops in full-length animated films such as Astro Boy and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. Hiryu: Started out as an accountant for big international auditing firm, but quit his job to pursue design. Now he's one of our co-founders as well as the guy who makes sure our budget and your funding is wisely spent. Hippocrite: Our music guy. Spent the last 10 years as a producer in the music biz. He's also one of our co-founders at Twitchy Finger in charge of all the music and sound designs for our game. Early character concepts of JoeWe've also teamed up with local music production Manna Sounds Studio, to create our soundtrack and SFX for Furball Rampage. Manna Sounds Studio is one of the newest state-of-the-art studios in Hong Kong that specializing in music production for international record labels, commercial jingles, radio, television and film. We are very lucky and honored to be collaborating with them on this project.      Manna Sounds StudioSoundtrack Samples from Furball RampageFurball Rampage Soundtrack Theme 1Furball Rampage Soundtrack Theme 2We started Twitchy Finger Games as a group of people with a shared vision. We want to make games that at its core are fun and enjoyable for those who play it. Right now we have a playable version of the game running. That being said, there's still a lot of work for us to make the game even better and more polished. This is where we need your help!    We know a lot of games that gone through Crowdfunding often don't get made or take a substantial amount of time before it gets released. We believe that if you guys are willing to fund us, we want to get the game out as soon as possible while at the same time meet the quality standards we've set for ourselves. That's why we kept the production time tight and make sure we have realistic attainable goals. We are looking to release the game within 60 days at the end of this campaign, so those of you who have supported us won't have to wait long or keep asking us before you see the results! Your funding will go directly towards our last phase of our development process: game balance, bug fixes, testing it on multiple platforms and if possible, as much additional content as possible before launch. We will be grateful with any contributions you can make!We can't stress enough how much we want to bring this out to everyone as soon as we can. Any questions you have, please feel free to ask us before pledging your donations. We want to make this process as comfortable and as transparent as possible. We know there are lots of games out there looking for funding, so we want let our supporters know exactly what they are funding and where it is going!   AND.... beyond our initial goal, we have other stretch goals that if met, means there's going to be even more cool stuff we can put into the game. The rewards for the stretch goals are even better. Check them out below! Here are some our stretch goals we hope to achieve!What's a crowdfunding campaign without some cool perks? All of our contributors will get our most sincere gratitude with their name listed in the credits (or not for those who prefer anonymous). On top of that, those that give significant contributions will receive some cool goodies specially made as a token of our appreciation! We have a mix of digital and physical perks for different tiers of contributions. I think we've struck a good balance between allocating your funds to our campaign needs while providing you guys with some great gifts. Please check out the perks section for a detailed explanation of the perks available.$1 or moreSupporter: Thank-you! Every dollar counts! We will put your name on the credit list (or not if you want to be anonymous) and you will receive email with our news, progress and updates! $5 or moreMellow Pack: Your name on credit list and Furball Rampage for iOS/Android plus bonus in-game gold to help you upgrade your character right away!$10 or moreNormal Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper and digital artwork booklet featuring game and character art.$15 or moreAnnoyed Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, and original digital soundtrack from the game. $20 or moreAngry Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, and Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage. Our 4" die-cut stickers$30 or morePissed-Off Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage, and a 16.5” x 23.5” Print of Furball Rampage Title Art.(Please add $5 USD to shipping)$40 or moreFurious Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage, a 16.5” x 23.5” Print of Furball Rampage Title Art, and a 36-page A5 art booklet containing concept art, level design art and sketches from the game. (please add $5 USD to shipping)$50 or moreSeething Pack: Name on credit list, bonus in-game gold, digital wallpaper, digital artwork book featuring game and character art, original digital soundtrack from the game, Three 4” die-cut stickers showcasing our main characters from Furball Rampage, a 16.5” x 23.5” Print of Furball Rampage Title Art, and a 68-page A4 “Making of Furball Rampage” collectors book that includes not only concept art, level design art, and sketches, but also liner notes and insights by our entire team. (This one is really cool! Collectors Item!!)(Please add $10 USD to shipping)Furball Rampage: The Collector's Artbook$100 or moreRage Pack: Everything from Seething Pack with Print and Collector’s Book signed and individually numbered by everyone here at Twitchy Finger Games. We’ll even throw in the 36-page A5 art booklet from the Furious Pack as well! (Please add $10 USD to shipping)$150 or moreInsanity Pack: Everything from Rage Pack + Limited Edition Furball Rampage 2015/16 Calendar and the unlock of our secret character unavailable at release. (Please add $10 USD to shipping)$200 or moreDestruction Pack: Everything from Insanity Pack + Furball Rampage T-shirt and a A4 celluloid artwork print.(Free shipping worldwide!)$500 or more (limited to 5)Developers Pack: Everything in Rage Pack plus a custom banner to promote your game in both iOS/Android for first 3 months of release. (Your game must be approved by the app stores of each platform and follow all the app store advertising guidelines) (Free Shipping Worldwide!)$1000 or more (limited to 10)Rampage Pack 1: Everything from Destruction Pack + we will get the Morgan Freeman voice actor used in our game trailer and have him record a short message of your choice just for you! He does a bunch of other celebrity impersonations too and we will give you a list to choose from. You can use it for your voicemail, ringtone or whatever you like!(Free Shipping Worldwide!)$1000 or more (limited to 10)Rampage Pack 2: Everything from Destruction Pack + Your name or name of choice for a Sidekick that we will put into our game! (Name cannot contain profanity or copyrighted brand names and will be approved at the discretion of Twitchy Finger Games)(Free Shipping Worldwide!)$3000 or more (limited to 3)Adopt-a-Hamster Pack: Everything from Destruction Pack + we will go to a local animal shelter and adopt a hamster in need of an owner, get the best cage we can find and fill it with the best quality food and toys we can get our hands on and promise to take care of the hamster for its entire life! We will limit this pledge to only three since we want to ensure the hamsters have enough care they deserve. We will post pictures of our adopted hamster and their pimpin’ habitat and post it on our social media sites and have regular updates of their news! (I’m pretty psyched about this one). (Free shipping worldwide: the items, not the hamster!)Below are some of the hamsters at SPCA waiting to be adopted! We will let you pick which hamster to adopt and give these adorable hamsters the best care possible for rest of their lives! SPCA- The Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals. $10,000 or more (limited to 1)Ultimate Pack: Everything from Destruction Pack + we will fly you in from wherever you live to visit us at Twitchy Finger Games in Hong Kong and meet our entire production team! We will include return tickets as well as 3 nights accommodations and a 1-day personalized sightseeing tour of Hong Kong! You get to fund our game AND have a vacation to experience Asia! (All other expenses such as transportation and food will be made by the backer)Hong Kong: Pearl of the Orient! We understand not everyone has the means to monetary contributions. So for those who want to help us out in other ways, here's some things you can do for us: Get the Word out on Social Media! You guys can help us by Following, Liking, Sharing or Pinning on our social media platforms. The more the better! FacebookTwitterPinterestInstagram: TwitchyFingerGamesHere's some special thanks for those who helped us out during this campaign.Manna Sounds Studio for their help with our soundtrack & sound effects. Jason's Voices for his help on our trailer's voice over. Great Morgan Freeman impression!

story:
Quick Summary

Hi, my name is Craig Greenway and I live in West Yorkshire in the UK.  I am passionate about creating games for mobile devices which are quick to play, fun and addictive.  I have been a software developer for 20 years, but recently found a desire to create games to explore my creative side.

The game I am hoping to raise funds for is called Road Skill and is a 3D endless runner game for Android and iOS mobile devices.  You have to dodge traffic while collecting coins to be used in the shop.  The store will have new characters to unlock, new modes of transport such as a skateboard and power-ups such as slowing down time or making coins float towards you.  Please feel free to view a snippet video at 

https://everyplay.com/videos/4814363


The biggest challenge faced for any new Indie developer like myself is just getting started - software costs, decent graphic and sound assets to help make your game stand out and look professional, devices to test on to be able to release games on more than one platform for example.

My passion and desire is never in question, getting up early and staying up late to find extra time is never a chore, and I love the sense of achievement it brings.  This has gotten me so far, but to produce polished games you need to invest a fairly small amount at least to really bring your game to life.  This is why I have turned to Indiegogo and its generous contributors for help!

One thing I have learnt from producing games is to run a beta programme to iron out bugs, engage users and make the game more enjoyable.  I will welcome your constructive feedback should you join the alpha and beta programmes that are planned, and you will have a real opportunity to help shape the game!  If successfully funded, I will be able to release this game for both Android and iOS platforms.  Currently I have published games only for Android devices but want to open this up to other platforms.  With your help this will be achievable!

How will the funds raised be used?

The game is being created in a development environment called Unity.  Currently I am using the free version but to bring this game to life and make it really sparkle, I will need the Pro version (around £900).

Additional player animations are also required and I have set a budget of £200 for these. These can make the difference between an OK-looking game and a great-looking game so definitely worth the extra investment!

I will also need to register with Apple to be able to publish on iOS devices and will need to buy a device for testing.  A budget of £600 has been set for iOS publication and the purchase of an iPad.

Finally I will need additional game art for items such as pickups and coins and have a budget of £100 for this area.

You may have noticed the sums don't add up to the amount I am hoping to raise?!  I am confident I can make a great game and happy to invest some of my own money into this project, but without some help I will need to cut back on some areas (specifically iOS publication and the purchase of Unity Pro).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate but would like to contribute in other ways, I would truly appreciate your help in spreading the word (use the Indiegogo share tools to make things easier).  If your friends love endless runner games, tell them about this game!

If you are an artist and can help with the creation of graphical assets for the game, that would be amazing as well.  Anywhere I can cut costs without impacting on quality will mean Road Skill will be a better game for it, as the money saved can be used on adding polish.

Thank you for viewing my campaign, and I hope to see you in the alpha and beta programmes!

story:
What is Gabe Newell Simulator?

Gabe Newell Simulator is an action horror FPS game in which you will be able to play Gabe Newell.
Gabe has finally decided to publish Half Life 3, but his employees disagree and will try to stop him at all costs, even by turning into monsters!
The whole project Half Life 3 is closed in the deepest meanders of the Valve Corporation, you will have to be able to survive to the numerous enemies to be able to find the game to publish it!
if you will not do it to us, you will disappoint all your fans and there will be nothing any more to be done... Half Life 3 will be never published!

Of What Use all this money?

To improve graphics, to add a dialogue system between various NPCs and to improve even more the gameplay.

The project is on the steam greenlight!

you can find the project on the steam greenlight in the following page ... 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetai...


What platforms will the game be available on?

The game will be available for PC Windows, Mac and Linux

How can you help the project?

Buying the game selecting one of the rewards or sharing the funds campaign on the social network.

Additions to the game

If the funds campaign reaches at least $5000 I will add a Gabe Newell statue in the game!

story:
Legends of Gyo is an MMORPG set in a mythical world ran by Celestial Dragons. These Dragons rule over the World of Gyo and all its inhabitants. 

But dark days are upon us and an ancient evil has awakened and taken over one of the Celestial Dragons that once protected us. This evil will use and manipulate the darkness in this Dragons heart to lay waste to everything and once again reclaim its former form and rule over all.

It is up to you as a player to join the ranks of the Dragon and climb the ranks to be chosen as a Celestial Dragon. To join the front lines  and save Gyo against absolute destruction by pure evil. 

Will you join the war against chaos?



  • The unique Art Style
  • The story and story telling
  • We"re an Indie Studio making an MMO
  • The world and world building
  • Games atmosphere and how it can change tempo of the game
  • The dedication of the team and support from the fans
  • Player to Developer relationship (we will be very involved with our community both in game and out)
  • Our events will be play based not cashed based
  • You play as a Dragon from the start (how cool is that?)
  • More planned in the near future like special GM world boss clashes, etc.

Player classes,


Currently we need funding for several aspects of the game to realize the end goal of completing the project.  Here is a list of needs we have as of now for the Alpha release we would like to have out this Winter.

  • More content (players, enemies, vegetation, props, weapons, etc.)
  • Refined back end for a better server/client structure to better enhance our player experience
  • Licenses to software we need to help complete the project in a much more efficient manner. 
  • Get an LLC to create our studio entity.
  • Server solutions to make sure we can allow our users to connect with little restrictions and limits we currently have.
  • More programming help to better create a more polished game play experience with added features.
The above can be accomplished with the desired $2,000 goal. 
$2,000 Breakdown,
  • $300 for LLC
  • VPS (sever solution for Alpha testing) $45/month
  • $700 for outsourced 3D and 2D art pieces to better establish a more filled out environment for our current map for the Alpha.
  • $800 Outsource an experienced freelance networking programmer to better refine our current setup. (should be roughly 2 weeks or less job by estimate).
Total = $1800 before VPS hosting. Which with $200 left gives us over a year of server hosting. 
Of course if we get over funded we will use the funding to make more improvements and additions to the Alpha sooner than later, you can find these additions further down the page.

Our small team of dedicated developers and artist are the ones putting this project together from the ground up. We call ourselves Hidden Blade Studios.

We are from all over the World and yet somehow have come together for a project that we all feel has potential and we hope all of you feel the same. It has been a battle to move forward and have come a long way in overcoming these challenges. 

  • $2000 -Finish Alpha this Winter
  • $3000- Release 2nd map
  • $4000- Release 2nd player class
  • $5000- Release 3rd player class.
  • $6000- Release 4th player class.
  • $7000- Release a better AI experience.
  • 10,000 and beyond- Release more new features and prepare for closed beta development.

Yes, and we strongly encourage it. You are all the back bone to this project and what keeps us motivated to continue on. here is how you can stay in touch or even lend a hand, thanks!

  • We are recruiting

http://forums.unrealengine.com/showthread.php?74019-Legends-of-Gyo-RPG

Again we appreciate all the support we get!

Total = $1800 before VPS hosting. Which with $200 left gives us over a year of server hosting. Of course if we get over funded we will use the funding to make more improvements and additions to the Alpha sooner than later, you can find these additions further down the page.
Our small team of dedicated developers and artist are the ones putting this project together from the ground up. We call ourselves Hidden Blade Studios.We are from all over the World and yet somehow have come together for a project that we all feel has potential and we hope all of you feel the same. It has been a battle to move forward and have come a long way in overcoming these challenges. 
$2000 -Finish Alpha this Winter
$3000- Release 2nd map
$4000- Release 2nd player class
$5000- Release 3rd player class.
$6000- Release 4th player class.
$7000- Release a better AI experience.
10,000 and beyond- Release more new features and prepare for closed beta development.
Yes, and we strongly encourage it. You are all the back bone to this project and what keeps us motivated to continue on. here is how you can stay in touch or even lend a hand, thanks!We are recruitinghttp://forums.unrealengine.com/showthread.php?74019-Legends-of-Gyo-RPGAgain we appreciate all the support we get!

story:
What Are We Doing? (Gamerate.net)

Gamerate.net is project last 18 months  developed by “one and half man”, that means that whole work on our project was made by just one developer (Me) and one administrator also called as “half man” (My brother, taking care about content, adding games, etc ;).

Official Gamerate.net description:

Gamerate is social based database of computer, electronic and board games. Players can track, organize and share their gaming history,  library of bought and finished games, and also rate and review games. Every action is connected with a date, what with number of totally played hours, finished games and spent money creates player’s lifetime history. Gamerate.net

 

Why we need funding & our story

Gamerate.net was officially launched after 18 months of preparation in June 2012. In the first year of working on our web page we were students and we didn’t have to care about money and financing. But in last 3/4 months of fulltime working, we realized that our savings are decreasing and life without income is quite difficult ;).
 

Come with startup from non-US or non-UK country is more difficult and this is reason why we decided to use IndieGoGo to help with funding Gamerate.net in the first year.

 

"Supported us" ribbon in your gamerate profile (3$ Perk). (See example)

 

What We Need

We decided to launch Gamerate even if it wasn’t completely finished, we still have got a lot of features and extensions to implement in our minds. To finish Gamerate to 98% of our plans we would be working at least for next 6 months and ideally for one whole year.

It will take some time until we will be able to finance whole project from advertising revenues. Any contribution and support will help us to work in next months. We will be able to focus without worries only on the implementation of new features and extending the Gamerate.net.

With 6 000$ and additional (small) incomes from advertising we should be able ensure work of one “cheap” fulltime developer (Me) and partly working “half man” for next 12 months.

6 000 - Fees = 5500$

$5500 / 12 months = 460$ per month + (ads income)

=

300$ + (ads income) / month for full time developer (Me)

160$ + (ads income) / month for part-time administrator

We will add your name or nickname to our supported us. (5$ Perk)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us, even if you can’t contribute (you probably spent your last money for Diablo 3 ;). You can share information about our project through social networks. You can create your Gamerate account, rate and review some games and invite your friends to follow you at Gamerate.net.

 

Gamerate premium account. (7$ Perk) (See example)

 

Other perks

Game chosen by you (Transport tyccon) as main page game. (10$ Perk)

 
 

Perk 20$+:

Choose your banner for Main page / Category page with approximate dimensions: 468px x 60px
Or
Choose your banner for page with game with approximate dimensions: 728px x 90px
 
(If you choose banner referring to charity or NGO we will double up the  number of displays)
(CPM is 1$ in 20$ perk, 0.75$ in 30$ perk, 0.5$ in 50$ perk, 0.4$ in 100$ perk, 0.36$ in 200$ perk)

 

Your banner in mainpage/category page.

Your banner in game page.

 

Thanks for help with redesign, graphical mentoring and also preparing IndieGoGo campaign to  @peterpiper_ / Peterpiper.sk

 

News in our campaign & Gamerate news

 

28. 8 We corrected and finished our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service

24. 8  We added screenshots and invitations to create account for visitors

22. 8 We finsihed redesigning of main and category pages

8. 8. First time had more than 3 000 unique visitors per day

31. 7. Added localized reviews (English, German, Slovak, Czech)

30. 7. We redesigned reviews

28. 7. Gamers can post messages to other gamers wall.

25. 7. We localized page to German

24. 7. We added timeline to gamer profile

18. 7. Gamer wall extension (filtering etc.)

13. 7. Redesign of page footer

2. 7. We implemented list of finished games

28. 6. We added FB personalized statuses

26. 6. Connected each game in our DB with Twitter #hashtag (See icongraphic)

21. 6. We finished lists of players (gamerate.net/players/)

19. 6. First time reached 1000 unique visitors per day

19. 6. Launch of Gamerate IndieGoGo campaign

4. 6. 2012 Official launch of Gamerate.net

story:
Three stories, three outcasts, three nerds… and a single destiny: to make the best video game ever. This is the basic premise of Indiecalypse, JanduSoft’s upcoming release, sadly based on actual events.

Indiecalypse depicts the crude reality of indie game developers and their struggles to get their shit together when it comes to releasing a video game. 

Three misfits team up to design and produce their own indie game, finding themselves in a path of chaos, self-destruction and resentment. But there’s also space for crude humor, pop culture references, gratuitous and non-gratuitous violence... and fear. Fear of the dozens of lawsuits for copyright infringement, obscenity and profanity we’ll have to face if the game is finally published.

It sounds wonderful, but… How do I play Indiecalypse?

In Indiecalypse we'll play as Jack Jackson (programming), Ethan Wornick (music) and Violet Oakly (art), and live their own particular stories. The game's main mechanic is based on modern exploration/adventure games, but Indiecalypse also includes more than 20 mini-games, most of them copied, sorry, based (let's say inspired by...) some of the most popular games and mechanics in video game history. Check them out below!

Not everything is what it seems in Indiecalypse, and we know for sure that no one will be left indifferent after playing it.

What are you waiting for? Help us complete this amazing game and join us on our epic adventure.  

Jack Jackson is the programmer, responsible for bringing “THE GAME” to life, and he’s the one who triggers the whole story. An ill-tempered, pretentious douchebag, his hygienic habits are at least questionable, and yet he’ll surely manage to win your hearts.

He’s our main character and the team leader.

Ethan Wortnick is the game’s musician, a talented composer and keytar master. The word “keytar”, by the way, is a blend of the words “keyboard” and “guitar”, in case you didn’t notice. Ethan is a cynical, easy-going fellow with a dubious lifestyle.

He’s Jack’s first ally and eventually becomes the voice of his conscience, or something like that...

Last but not least, there’s Violet Oakly, the team’s lead artist. A former fine art’s A-grade student, a series of unfortunate events molded Violet’s personality into the hysterical leery concept artist she is now. 

She’s the last member to join the team, and becomes Jack’s second right hand. Because it’s always useful to have two right hands.

Indiecalypse is filled with references to some of the most popular -and not so popular- video games in history. The many mini-games scattered throughout the main game are our particular tribute to those titles that somehow have defined our miserable lives. In its essence, Indiecalypse is a heartfelt confession, an invitation to recall our sentimental memoirs as gamers. 

Graphic artist Héctor Toro (@Narehop) is responsible for the game’s visual style. He has collaborated with brands such as Sony Playstation, Nintendo, Riot Games or Movistar among many others. The style depicted in Indiecalypse reflects his own vision of the animation that can be seen on television nowadays. This style, known as “Calarts” is often used by Disney and Cartoon Network to appeal to family friendly audiences. In the game, he wanted to create this striking contrast between cartoon animated drawing style and adult themes, gore, grotesque situations and black humor.

References are a very common tool in audiovisual work.  In Indiecalypse, Pau Damià Riera (@paudamiariera), composer and sound designer with broad experience in animation, advertising and -of course- video games, has used well-known references as creative inspiration, paying tribute to all-time great film and video game scores.  An exercise in style that comprises music and sound effects belonging to every possible genre, according to the eclectic and satirical narrative of the game. 

The game will be released in English, Spanish, German & French. 

If you want Indiecalypse in another language, leave us a comment and we'll see if we can make it possible. 

If you want to collaborate to translate the game to your language, don’t waste a minute! 

Contact us as soon as possible. 

 

Indiecalypse will be real and shall live forever on your dusty shelves or in your wettest dreams. 

But what if we manage to exceed this budget? Well, we’ll keep on adding new goals to unlock that will help us make Indiecalypse an even better game.

 

PD: We will not upgrade the stretch goals any more after our kickstarter campaign. The game it's nearly finish production.

 *any resemblance with Blashpemous’ Kickstarter is purely coincidental. 

Indiecalypse is in development for Windows PC , PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch and Xbox One. As we have experience porting games to consoles, all versions will be released at the same time. 

Below you can find the eight suckers who are currently working on this game. If you have any complaints, now you know who to address them. 

If you don’t trust these individuals, we won’t blame you. So you may take a look at some of the projects JanduSoft has previously released, some of them even in physical format. Don’t be scared and check out the company’s website. 

http://www.jandusoft.com 

You can support us as you wish.The bigger supporter you are, the better reward you’ll obtain! Below you can find a list with the available rewards so far. 

Do you need more rewards to share with a friend? Don't worry, we are here to help you.   

*Add a digital copy of the game($15)

*Add a physical artbook ($9)

*Add a physical OST ($9)

*Add a physical Deck ($9)

*Add a physical copy for PS4 or Nintendo Switch ($39)

*Add a physical Figurine ($99)
